Rust is interesting blend of what i would say is a survival game and csgo. It requires a ton of skill to get settup and do stuff.

However, the way it is set up makes pushing down the lower people way too fuckin easy. Unless you get lucky theres almost no way to get better gear. Hemp is for some reason extremely rare and it makes it incredibly difficult to make sleeping bags (respawn points) or bows (a very good weapon but still just a bow).

The game is filled with these crazy sweats that go on genocide runs murdering people with literally nothing just to cause chaos and place pressure on people with less time, are new, or have just started. I played last night and i was literally spawn camped with ak47s, nail guns, snipers, all kinds of shit. Meanwhile this was a BEGINNER FRIENDLY SERVER. no deals were made, no words exchanged, no benefit gained on either side other than senseless violence in order to make me, a new player, feel like shit.

I disminished stereotypes i had all along, and witnessed others to do the same vice-versa. Unforgettable Moments shaped our timebeeing side by side. This Game gave me more than Raids and Superiorety above Others. It gave me Friends and intercultural Exchange i could barely belelieve beein possible beforehand. I highly wish some of you are expereincing similar Stories. "Its not about the Treasure you seek about finding in the End. Its about the Journey that leads you upon on IT"

A game where you can do anything, but the world and players will stop you at every pass.

Rust is a game that can be insanely enjoyable and a challenge at every turn, but it is vital new players know what they are getting into. Getting into the game and getting start has a large barrier to entry as just getting past primitive tech can be an endeavor in and of itself. I would recommend anyone starting this game go in with a crew of people they know and have good tolerance. Friendship within the game is few and far between and you are most likely to get a bullet to the head than a friendly face.

Additionally, the risk of a raid is ever present. While it is possible to make deterrents, you are never truly safe. Every log in may inform you of your death while offline and all your hard earned progress stolen and reduced to rubble, With all that said, the highs of victory. the joy of a good find, or the elation of crafting your first firearm can be amazing. I would recommend anyone curious of the game enter tentatively and with the expectation that your progress can and eventually will be reset at any time.

Pros:
Gameplay is easy to understand and fairly intuitive
Obtaining progress is very fulfilling
Mods of the game are very quick on removing/banning cheaters.

Cons:
Dealing with other players can be annoying and frustrating.
Barrier to entry is a steep.

Another issue is that Rust is not newbie friendly, even after watching YouTube videos and googling tips and tricks, game-play does not make it easy to navigate the keys/controls as well as simple functions find safety. 

Other than that, once you figure things out and befriend kind players, it can be fun. I think the positive part of the social side of Rust is what keeps it enjoyable.

If you VALUE YOUR TIME I would NOT recommend you to play this game.
It is heavily grind based, and it gets boring really fast.
But still, IT CAN get you on the hook. Because, it exploits human biology like in the way gamble machine does. For me it explains why people spending their time on this game in extreme manner. Risk is present all the time (not necessarily a fair one). Some times you won't have a choice to set up your "bet" and will have to go "all in". And no matter of outcome, win or lose, it's getting boring.

Few more words...

What's good:
- Crafting system is decent
- Electricity mechanic is good

What's bad:
- Game is boring, PVE elements and PVP doesn't save it.
- Events, puzzles, something doesn't click with them.
- Procedural maps do not make much of a difference, they look very same.
- Loading to a server takes a while
- Cartoonish vibe (compare to DayZ, but DayZ has much poorer craft/build mechanics)
- So called UPKEEP mechanic is really bad at the current moment 
(it forces you to connect to the server everyday if you have large/expensive base (Official servers))
- No MAIN win goal. It is probably just "play more and dominate more" (one of the reasons it gets boring even if you're getting better).

So in the end we have very grinding, mainly PVP game, that i would describe as minecraft_for_adults, with (!) cartoonish vibe, and the game forcing you to LIVE in it if you want to be good at it. And it feels like even if you are already good enough, you still need to live in it to have your fun.
...Not my recomendation. I'll leave it for those who like it...

over my first 100 hours of the game i spent the majority of it just learning the basic mechanics and overall just learning the game. It was most definitely very frustrating at times but after you learn the basics and have an idea of what to do its a very fun game.

Rust was once a great game, I loved it. I had never put so much time into just 1 game before, I could play it for hours upon hours with friends. Over the years of playing from 2013 all the way to 2021, I had learned to perfect the recoil and become decently skilled at the game. 

Sadly over the last year, the dev's dropped a patch which absolutely fucked the gunplay and made it incredibly easy for anyone with 1 hour to 10k hours pick up a gun and just use it with no skill involved, just pull crouch pull down. It's sad for all the players who have put so much time into Rust, who took hours and hours to learn the recoil and become insanely skilled for it all to be taken away. 

I've tried to get back into the game, but it's just not fun anymore. I wish Facepunch would make it an option for some servers to enable old gunplay/sounds, but god knows if they ever will.

Rodarius Marcell Green (born August 27, 1998), better known as Rod Wave, is a platinum-selling recording artist originally from St. Petersburg, Florida.

Following the release of three albums under the Hunger Games series title, Rod rose to national prominence after dropping “Heart on Ice” in 2019. The track, a single for his album PTSD, peaked at number 4 on the Billboard Hot 100 with assistance from TikTok and a viral Genius live performance.

Rod continued to garner critical acclaim with the release of Ghetto Gospel in November of 2019 and Pray 4 Love in April of the following year.

In June of 2020, he survived potentially life-threatening injuries after crashing into a pole at over 100 miles per hour. Recovering from internal brain bleeding, he reflected on his trauma on the track, “Through the Wire.” Pain, past and present, remains a recurring subject matter in his music.

In 2021, Rod released SoulFly, a 19-track project assisted by the singles “Street Runner” and “Tombstone.”

This is a GREAT game but the cheaters plague the game. I am not trying to act like I am "good" with only 860 hours but the amount of cheaters is astonishing. Im not talking about someone BEAMING you from hundreds of meters away. Those might just be "skilled" players. I am talking about sneaking up on someone and they are just waiting for you. They look at you through walls and should have no idea that you are even there. There is no element of surprise on rust. There are WAY too many situations where you are dead at the respawn screen asking yourself if that guy was cheating. You will never be the best in the lobby unless youre running a MASSIVE group. Youll never be like those solo rust videos you see on youtube. Just wont happen. This game has a LOT of potential but because of all the cheaters, Im finally done. The stress and toxicity isnt worth it. Save yourself the time and headache and just go play something else. This game used to be great in its golden era. But now every single last server you join will have some rage hacker who just walls, aimbots and raids all day. When that account gets banned, they make a new one and do it again. Rust isnt like other games where progression matters and will set even a hacker back. Hackers join in and immediately start snowballing. Admins in MOST servers are pretty non existent. Even in the larger servers where admins ARE present, youll see someone getting banned usually every hour for cheating. But heres the thing, they just get banned from THAT server. They are free to go plague another server until Facepunch eventually issues a perma ban. Seriously, unless you plan on playing in a PvE server(Which is PAINFULLY) boring, dont buy this game.

Rust is a great, well written, pure piece of innocent fun and camaraderie. Spawned naked on a beach with nothing but a rock, you seek out on an adventure to cook meth and find Heisenburg. Based in Alexandria, you find Rick Grimes early on in a breath-taking adventure. Personally I have never had more fun upgrading my sniper monkeys and taking out the camo balloons that threaten my base and way of life. This game has quite literally moved me to tears...not because of the incredible story telling and heart breaking scenes, but because of the insurmountable time that has been ripped away from me. All I wanted was to farm sulfur on a remote island with Bryan Cranston, but instead I get a plate full of dirt, and a clan of newborns who somehow tracked me down across the map to foundation wipe me. All in all, it was a great experience, fighting off the dead and establishing my own community, and family I can come home to at night. Rust has built me up as a character, a survivor, much like negan of the walking dead series. But just as easily, as torn me down just like negan from the walking dead series. I love Heisenburg, but the devs refuse to let me reunite with my lover. If there is one tip I can give to new Rust players, is to watch out for the white walkers that periodically invade Alexandria. I wake up in cold sweats because of Rust, but Rust has also impregnated me with a love that none can beat, Heisenburg.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

This is a great game for someone who loves competitive environments. 
There is a server for each play-style, whether it's PVP, PVE, creative, role-play, and many more. 

For PVE (and inevitable PVP), there are many "monuments" that are inhabited by armed scientists whom are guarding treasure whether it be in a time-locked box or hidden behind doors that require a key-card you've gotten by running another monument. There are different monuments varying in amount of scientists and difficulty of survival. 

For creative folks, there are many servers that will allow you to focus on making an aesthetic base while having to do little to none of the farming for you designed masterpiece. 

For folks that enjoy role-playing there are a few active servers that have a small community dedicated to this. They are quite like little societies, in where they have laws, events, hotels, shops, and a small community.

While the community is generally pretty kind on role-play servers, the other server's communities are pretty hit or miss. You can meet some nice people. You can also meet some rather unpleasant folks. If I'm being entirely transparent, you can expect some blatant disrespect when you are bested; but that's video games for you! 

All in all, it's a good game for someone who enjoys survival games and a challenge. While this is a game that can be enjoyed solo, there are strengths to forming alliances; Strength in numbers. One of the best parts of the games is managing to find someone you can build trust with in the game. You can build large compounds and raid others. You can roam the map and find unsuspecting farming players, who've been kind enough to take the hard work out of farming for you.

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a Virtual Youtuber empire for over a year now and using me as his recruiter. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my Live2D knowledge to recruit talents, which he would then hire using his connections in the Japanese utaite world. Connections that he made through his career with Niconico. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small indie channel could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Motoaki "Yagoo" Tanigo, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Yagoo threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Yagoo had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Yagoo flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Yagoo was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Riku Tazumi , he plotted to kill Yagoo, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Cover Corp, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my vtubing activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

TL;DR: A great game for anyone who is equipped to handle a moderate amount of toxicity.

What a great game this has become.
When I picked the game up in 2017 it was not a lot more than it's incredibly toxic community, but over the years Facepunch has made something absolutely incredible out of it.
The pacing has evolved into something great, since with a lot of Updates came a lot of new features and what was once a game where you could only build bases and kill your own has steadily become a game full of different Monuments with PvP and PvE content, there is Wildlife and Scientists that attack you every chance they get and there is also a lot of other Players roaming around that also attack you every chance they get.
The amount of great experiences I have had in Rust is just insane, I have made friend and enemies, farmed countless hours just to get revenge and raided with neighboring Zergs I hardly even knew all in all I have a lot of good memories from all my time in this game.
Although the Community is still probably one of the most toxic on the Internet, a good Neighbor is found or a great friend is made on almost every Wipe. If you look hard enough and if you can stomach 5-8 toxic people to find someone with whom you can play countless hours and have fun just so that they betray you in the end and change all the codes to your base, then this is just the game for you.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Oh boy, this is a tough one. Is the game fun? Absolutely. But would I recommend it to new players? No way.

The game plays well and feels good to play. The only problem is that everything is so mechanically min-maxed by people with 3k hours that if I log out of my stone base for literally two hours I'll come back to have everything demolished and have to start again (this is on wipe day).

The gameplay loop is compelling, but it has become clear that you'll need to endure a lot to become halfway decent at the game.

I'm going to continue playing on and off, trying again on new servers and wipes, but I feel like this is a problem of it being a hardcore survival game that is getting close to a decade old.

toxic, not rewarding in any sense, 9-5 play style required, have to have foreigners or no lives in clan or else you'll get offlined while you sleep, have to race inland, but if your not one of the first off wipe good luck, official is best, however it's not great, 2x-x servers are just rust battle royale, you will face racism and other forms of toxic chat, but that's any online game with prox vc, so i'm not going to complain about people being people when you can just hunt and wipe said people clean. overall, would not recommend, so much so that i would actually recommend not watching rust content as well. i fell into this game from a yt video and i will tell you rust does not play anything like what you may have watched. unless it was a 'raiding toxic kids/clan' type video, then yeah your experience may play somewhat close to what you've watched, but other than that Rust is an all around negative experience and i would not recommend you dump hours into this game bc you will have nothing to show for it.

donated my life to this game and I don't regret it, I have bare memories with my big boy @phodog07. This game brought me and @phodog07 closer than I could ever imagine. I know more about this man (little boy) than anyone else. He is my best friend because of this game. We watched movies about this game together whilst snuggling under a blanket. Then we grinded the game for 25 hours a day. Rust became my life. I would wake up and think about rust, I would sleep and dream about rust. I use to attend meetings with @phodog07 where we would dress up as rust characters and get freaky. I miss the days of lockdown where we would play this game whilst teachers taught us important life skills. Sometimes a person called @ryanhall1902139 would join and these would be the best wipes. Me, @phodog07 and @ryanhall21930231 would become the best trio known in the game. @ryanhall2931821 actually introduced me to the game and I am forever thankful for that. Me and @phodog07 do not speak as much as we used to as the game became dead and pretty shit tbh. But nonetheless I am forever grateful for the time I got to spend with @phodog07 playing this game. I still remember random wipes and the laughs and giggles they would bring us. Even though we were both terrible at the game and @phodog07 would usually rage off after I kill him in our base it would only bring us closer. It was about 7 months in when I began to gain feelings for @phodog07 and eventually would propose to him. He said no and called me a freak and we stopped speaking for a month or two. Until we hopped back on the game and grinded none stop once again. This, after fortnite, minecraft, do you know de way, gorky 17 and monopoly might be the best game I have ever owned. I wish I could play one more wipe with @phodog07. I really miss how close we were. Now I realise how lonely I am. I often spend all day alone with no one to talk to. This is where I'd typically bell my man @phodog07 up and we'd hop back on the grind. But we can longer do that as his pc blew up and it wont be able to run this game. I dont think he'll ever invest the money back in order to get a new gpu as that time has unfortunately passed. However, I will always cherish the time I spent on this game. I have never laughed as much as I have during this time. Thank you @phodog07 and @ryanhall21736123 for all the time we spent together. My best wipe was with @ryanhall21392103 and @twisted. This was the wipe that @phodog07 actually got the game but we locked him in the base and never let him leave. I'm surprised he didn't just refund the game at that point but thank god he didn't. I hope one point we can return to the game, it's a shame that won't be any time soon. I love this game.

Once you learn how to fit in to the "trust no one" toxic culture of Rust, you learn to love it. Id recommend looking up what the rookie mistakes are to avoid in the game (since the mistakes can cost you your entire base). The combat and rush you get from fights in this game is unmatched since everything is at stake in every fight. Only thing that sucks is putting in the hours then getting offline raided but there's ways to outsmart the raiders and plenty of traps you can set up; sometimes still isn't enough though so be warned. I never did the mobile phone notification route but if you are that committed, there's that option. 
Overall, this is one of the best, most well rounded games that is out right now if you can commit to the hours of game play it takes to find a good server, then to learn a good base design and strategy to prosper in the world of Rust.

Let me start by saying I have played Rust since it was playable in your browser & it is truly insane to see how far the game has come from that point. I'm someone who for the longest time refused to switch over to current Rust and instead tried so hard to keep Rust Legacy alive and breathing, however, just a few years ago I finally folded and gave it a try and I was shocked! Facepunch had poured their hearts and souls into this game for years at this point, and just when I think the game is already beyond great, they add something new or make changes that actually strongly improve the flow of the game.

Rust is a STRONG recommend for any PC gamer out there, it's up there with the giants such as Counter-Strike at this point and it's well deserved, albeit, the game is one that is daunting to play as a Solo. I am aware there are Solo based servers but they heavily restrict alliances and making friends as you go, but when you play a normal Official Server on average people will chase you down even if you're just starting (naked). Playing with people, whether it be 2-8 can be a blast however and with all the various ways to gain scrap/mats nowadays you can easily get top tier loot and compete against the bigger clans. I do genuinely love getting into a Rust wipe every now and again, allowing it to consume the vast majority of my free time and you will find if you gave it a shot how insanely time consuming the game can be. Now that's referring to Official servers, there are tons and tons of modded/community based servers that allow for a more casual experience, even ranging from big team battles similar to Battlefield games, gun game like CS or CoD, Team Deathmatch and more! 

Definitely a must buy for anybody on Steam in my honest opinion and worth spending some time in, the Devs love this game as the players do as well!

Maybe if you're more familiar with survival first person shooters the experience would be different. Maybe I'm the dumb one. But I've played this for long enough that I feel like I should have gotten something out of this experience by now.

The crafting, looting, and building mechanics are very well thought out. They're satisfying and simple with enough complexity to never be boring. There's enough breadth to feel spanning, enough depth to feel meaningful, and the shallow end is enough to be interesting on its own. But the main core of the gameplay, the pvp. The raids. Even updated to be more friendly to people like me its brutal.

Everyone you meet feels like they have a thousand hours and twenty friends who play this game. You lose as a matter of course, and in that small percentage of times when you win you get killed by your targets friends or a third party. In almost thirty hours of any game you expect to feel somewhat comfortable in a role, even if it's the role of a beginner. Here you don't. I'm sure at some point you do, but I can't recommend this because the newer player experience is awful and it stays awful for entirely too long.

i had a lot of hope when first joining rust; it seemed like a great looking game. I had been looking for a multiplayer post-apocalyptic game to play; it seemed like just the thing since there is quite a limited variety of  games that serve this purpose. I was wrong. dead wrong. lets start with the obvious. griefers. as a "naked" which these griefers affectionately call us it is a shark eat shark world. if you are lucky (very lucky) enough to get a shotgun early on: (which so few of us are lucky enough) you can hold your own. but those who are not lucky enough get killed on site by people who argue that because it is a PVP game it doesnt matter; but it does when you can't even start the game and get ahead with a community as toxic as this one.  people will attack you on site for the simple crime of being a "naked" and call you a "noob" for not being good at the game yet. I say it is impossible to become good at the game when people do not give you the chance to get good at it. 
    becoming a pro at anything takes practice, and without the chance to practice things such as building, and crafting, and arming yourself you cannot "get good" at the game. It seems that only the lucky ones get ahead and if you are as unlucky enough as I was in this game you will be killed relentlessly as a solo player. even more so that I don't have friends who play this game. however unlike these griefing nutjobs and their Micro cocks attacking me on site I actually have friends in real life and don't have hours to spend on a game that keeps resetting your character so you have nothing upon death unless you have had adequate time to farm resoources to build at the very least a cottage of sorts to hold items in; (newsflash) griefers won't even give you time to do that and they can even break into your home and take all of your hard earned belongings. this game was not built so that people could have a good time and experiencine truly surviving an apocalypse. it was built so that mean people could ruin your fun and make up for the little manhood they have by killing you. ten out of ten would NOT suggest this for someone who wants to play a multiplayer apocolypse game. it is simply impossible to have a fair shot at even starting the game.

I am a 51 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, joined a server and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and we went in to a server and played together. loved it as it was the best time i had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

You will die a lot, you'll die and lose a lot of progress each time. Your only choice is to get better, and spend a while on the wiki looking at how to make things and damage charts, weapons, explosives, how to get them and make them. 

There are relaxed, PVE servers but I imagine there are other games more fun for that. The main point of this long term is the PVP.

Its got a huge skill roof that you would need to break ASAP if you want to advance at all in the game. Its very realistic and it requires you to pour time and effort. While you're farming as a naked or skirmishing with other players as a geared player, anything can happen ranging from losing the battle and losing a lot of stuff to losing items you farmed. The whole point of this game however is to lose and rebuild back up. Will you be on the top of the skill chain of the server, or will you be easy pickings for the higher-ups of the server?

This game will literally take your life over, finding food is more rare than an ak. if you buy Rust beware that you are at extreme risk of high blood pressure, losing your home/job (because rust will become your job), and you will risk being mentally unstable. proceed with caution. :)

This game is generally pretty good and I've had a really fun time playing it. However it is horrendously unoptimised. I know my setup isn't the best and the maps I was playing on weren't the easiest to handle either. But still. I am barely able to run the game at 40 fps with lowest quality settings at 1080p with screentearing and huge lagspikes. All this while with 5-10 minute start up times and 10-20 miute load in times. in comparison; I can start up Halo Infinite in 3 minutes and play with stable 60-80 fps at high settings. and 20 second load in times for matches. Similarly it takes me 3 minutes to start up dishonored 2/disonored doto and I can play it at stable 60 fps with high settings and 15 second load times. Just recently the game has started crashing not only itself but the whole of steam as well. It's kind off a 50/50 gamble if I'll be able to start the game without crashing and I'll be able to play for at most 30 minutes before it crashes again, if it didn't crash after loading in. I've tried solutions to these issues suggested online, like verifying the game files, but so far it hasn't helped.

Developers, if you're reading this, please fix your game.

After almost 5k hours, I have some thoughts.  This game is what we always dreamed about for decades.  A game you could get your friends together and battle it out as a group against up to 600 other players.  This battle for supremacy lasts up to a month.  You will have stories about the back and forth battles between you and zerg clans, toxic kids, and relentless opponents.  With a group, you can be a specialist too.  you can be a builder, fly, dive/boat, grind, farm, trade, or whatever skill best helps out your team.  It's an amazing achievement and there's nothing like it.   If you're gonna play official or similar "big" servers, it's not for the weak.  You'll want to aim train.  Smaller, community type servers can be chill and a great way to explore the landscape and defeat the ai vehicles, ai, and monument characters.  You might just make a few friends along the way.

It doesn't feel like more than 1400 hours have been recorded in my playing history of rust, in the last 4 months since i own this game.

The first time i entered this game, i did not understand what was actually being done in this game, i only found a main character who was completely naked while carrying stones and torches that suddenly appeared on the beach. Hours passed and i began to understand what was in this game, and when i started to understand this game, i said that this is the best game i have ever found in my life (although basically i'm not a pure gamer).

My curiosity and addiction to this game continues to emerge even though i say that i have fully understood what is in this game, unlike other games in rust fps, shooter, survival, pvp, pve, building, farming are presented and packaged very well which gives a different feel when i try other games that are even said to be similar, almost everything i like and expect in a game is in rust. So yeah, because of the many features that also make everyone who plays can't spend a short time, because there are many things to do in the game to be enjoyed in the fastest time possible to excel in the game. And well, ever since i started playing and addicted to this game, my time is very much taken without notice, and my work is affected by it because i am also a person who doesn't have a time bond set or set by others so i'm free to decide what i should to do and what i want to ignore makes me spend time in this game imperceptibly.

Because it started from curiosity in myself, basically i'm just a solo player trying hard to excel in the game and survive in the wilderness life in rust, although sometimes i realize that i need to play with other teams and people but what do i need? chase is to answer my curiosity about every thing i have to do alone. Since playing this game i have many new friends and joined many teams and yeah, it is very fun when you are decided to play games with your friends without feeling lonely, fun or various drama i have been through a lot in this game, and that's the thing which gives a sense in playing the game.

Now one more thing that makes me more curious is about cheats, many players throw words about a cheater in the game, whether it's words to defend themselves because they feel lost to each other or it's really true, i want to know about, is there really a cheat in this game.

So yeah, because i'm just an amateur looking for everything based on the top browser results, i found a site that rents out their cheat services, to be precise, esp, i immediately tried and wanted to know if it was true that esp was in this game. And yes, cheats do exist in this game, i found i had access to see what i shouldn't be able to see in normal mode, in conditions of cheat features that didn't match what the seller said i was a little hesitant and repeatedly complained to the seller about this, but what they say in my opinion is just bullshit, because i think the cheats they sell are not perfect.

In the end i found my account was suddenly banned by the developer because i found cheating within a day after i used the cheat although not more than 2 hours, i tried many things after i found that i was banned from playing Rust and at least 5 new accounts have been banned too because of the strict ban that has been given to me.

Now, in my opinion is yes, the cheat/esp really exist in this game even though i haven't used that feature in a long time but i also don't want to try other products and don't want to try hard to be able to play the game anymore.

I've decided maybe this is the right time for me to take a break from this game. It's time to back in real life for me, and it's time for me to get married soon, and think about a family in the future.

However, rust is a treasure i've ever found in my life. Thanks to rust, and my friends in-game have filled my dark days, maybe rust will be my secret treasure that i might find come back later when i feel iRL is so tired.

Rust. The "most challenging survival game." This game has drained me mentally and physically. I have almost a years play time and it has honestly taken an entire years worth of social life away from me. I stopped playing in May of 2022 because the developers do not know how to update or maintain their game properly. Face-punch makes themselves look horrible due to all the updates that favor the "new players" or the "role-playing." Rust is not that hard if you just put a bit of time into learning the game. We all start somewhere with it. The game has to many different things that the developers add instead of fixing the game with the fps issues, the lack of optimization to the game, the exploits, and glitches. The developers add new things to the game instead of listening to their player base and fixing the common issues among-st all the players. Over the last 3 months - 2 years they have been babying the player base and not hearing what the longtime vets recommend. Overtime, friends and I have become extremely disappointed with this game. It is no longer enjoyable like it used to be, and has become to easy for the new players to get a jump on it. Most of the time you would have new groups with people over 1k hours, but now, you have people joining groups with like 200 hours on an aim train server because they can "shoot an AK." This game has become nothing but aim, and no brain. Face punch has made me lose interest in this game quick and easily, and you hear people say "rust is to hard to quit, it's addicting." But in all seriousness, once you realize how terrible the game has become, it is not worth the time an effort playing. I no longer support this game, and I do not recommend it to anyone due to the careless and worthless efforts put into this game by the developers.

Got this on discount, rarely write reviews and just unsatisfied about a lot of the game. For how much popularity it gets it feels like there are obvious bugs that are not fixed, As well as mechanics that are just overall bad. I would only recommend this game to players that enjoy pvp. The few key points I do like are, you need to farm a lot to keep your base maintained as well as to raid other people. But with big servers with hundreds of people, resource respawns can either not go your way or you have to fight to actually get a good base going, the very little that I meet the community only want to manipulate you for kills. 1/3rd to half of my hours are MOSTLY loading times, I haven't been able to tell how the AI even begins to work, I've sat right next to things that should attack me but don't while other times I can't even see them and I just start getting blasted. Also lack of being able to edit your character in anyway really set the tone off for this game at a bad start. I was also told that you can get cosmetics just from playing the game but I haven't seen any yet and seems like there is a extremely limited shop. Overall I think that it has potential to be a really fun game but lacks some small details to make it fun, right now it's just massive chores in a game.

So before I bought this game I was a virgin. Throughout the years I have owned this game that has changed. I really anjoy playing this game even considering buying the full DLC bundle. It is a lot of fun and is great to play with friends. Now back to the story point. Before I owned this game I was a virgin until my second server. I log in as usual and a few of my friends hop in, now at the time I was talking to this girl ya know. Nothing serious although I had the biggest crush on her at the time. During the night she was asking if she could come over and sleep over. Now reading this at the time, I was around 16/17 in 11th grade, so my heart was racing and I told her to come over at around 2:30/3:00 am, I sent this around 11pm and she agreed. Now fast forward to around 2:00am, me and my buddies are in our Rust server chilling in our base and then we heard it, the first rocket. Later that night I would text my friend that was a girl and cancel the plans, as that was the first time I was ever fucked in the ass.

Rust is amazing. Use your rock, get wood, get stone, pick all the hemp you see, craft some clothes you animal, make a bag, craft a bow, craft some arrows, find food, craft tools, get more wood, get more stone, build a shack, craft some boxes, go kill some bears for fuel, die to a bear, hit some barrels for fuel instead because bears suck, craft some furnaces, get metal, cook metal, cook LOTS of metal, save all that charcoal because you’re gonna need it, start looting roads and monuments while trying not to die, build a tier one workbench if you’re a noob and can’t go straight to a two, get more wood, get more metal, get more scrap, expand shack, upgrade expanded shack to unraidable base, what time is it? it’s sulfur time, get sulfur, cook sulfur, cook LOTS of sulfur, make gunpowder with all that charcoal you saved because you were gonna need it, craft ammo, start farming hard, get a decent weapon, craft meds, craft LOTS of meds, oh snap cargo is up go get that AK and bolty, kill everyone you see and take all their stuff - it’s yours now haahahahha, go double up at Bandit and make a tier three, farm more, and more, and more, build a heli tower, avoid rockets, take down heli, if you aren’t packing C4 and a launcher by now you might be bad at Rust, turn everything you see into explosives because this friendly person you gave four pumpkins to turned around killed you and took all your stuff and you need revenge - you need it bad, store all those explosives in your super secret spot in your unraidable base, go get a Red Bull cause you’re waiting for this dirtbag to log and it’s gonna be awhile, maybe take a shower too, get back to your computer, respawn cause dirtbag killed you, run back to your base, it’s locked and you can’t get in and you can hear dirtbag’s entire team mocking you from inside their new unraidable base, cry a little but never admit it, start back at square one angrier than you have ever been before. Like I said. Amazing.

Man, this game is something else. Have you ever dumped so many hours into one simple little base? Well, if you have its probably been on minecraft. Has it ever gone away in a matter of minutes or seconds? Maybe to those pesky creepers or that one "friend" who decided to be a little goofball that day and blow it up. And thats what rust is, a bunch of silly little goof balls in the same server competing to be the biggest goofball. It usually comes to those with the biggest group, or the one who doesnt have a job and plays rust all the time. Back to the little base part, it can be your home for an entire wipe (every couple weeks or days the server resets so everyone gets a fresh start) or for a minute or 2. But then comes those silly little goofballs, they blow it up, wait outside the base to kill you and "go deep" while youre unaware of the situation. All your hard work gone, well... it would have been gone any way right? The server would just reset and everyone would have to start out at square one. But, you slowly start to realize that the fun comes from messing with "nkeds" and raiding/killing others. Become the silly little goofball, the smartest and most skilled goober will have the most fun in this game we call rust. Also be aware of the racists :)
If you hate yourself and want to learn to hate others then this is the perfect game for you.

First 9-10 hours, on PvE server, were fun. Learn how to get stronger, gear up, build base, explore the world and see the different special locations etc. Feel finally ready for the actual "thing", jump into a server with relatively low-mid pop, first hour mostly playing as in PvE but weary of your location/surrounding, suddenly 1 hit from a crossbow of a guy hiding in a corner and dead. Oh well, happens I guess

Join new server, more weary than before and server is called "Beginner Friendly"... until less than a hour later you're engaged by 2 dudes with crossbow while you've just a wooden spear and instatly killed, no warnings. Alright!

Must be just bad luck and bad server, right? But then again... you know what... official servers have a decent odd to have hackers on... community ruled ones are mostly one sided for several other reasons... modded ones are plain weird and mixed experience.

Finally, the wiping system and huge requirement of activity, unless playing on Monthly reset servers, but there you get other issues to deal with.

To put it simply:

boring chore that you're better off not playing, minimun 8-10 minutes of load to get in a server on SSD with overwhelming higher specs, huge issues with RAM handling, absolutely garbage optimisations and dated graphics. Forgot, combat is mostly shit aswell, camping / ratting / groups vs solo or zerg vs group etc... yeah you'll want to pass on this, just play games like Tarkov or The Cycle: frontier, honestly at least there you can have solid fun for 30-40 hours and perhaps even more if you dig the gameplay, and the game doesn't just piss on beginners/newplayers or casuals, also doesn't have insane time requirements and timelimited runs.

The community? Average mental and actual age is way lower than you could expect which leads to a very further unfun experience
Prepare to dedicate your life to this game. It has the biggest highs and the lowest lows all  wrapped up into this ever changing and immersive game.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Shame... this game looks like it *could* be really enjoyable.  Maybe once upon a time, it was - I wouldn't know.  Unfortunately, however, the entire community - virtually EVERY existing server included - is currently just completely inundated with griefers, trolls and bad faith players.  New players to this game do not stand ANY remote chance, as you'll inevitably be shot/have your head bashed in within 10s in virutally any server you try spawning into.  It's basically like trying to play Day-Z, except with a Fortnite user base.  Likewise, the existing community is so incredibly gatekeepy that it's pointless even trying to search through the guides(most of them aren't actually guides, just sarcastic remarks by wannabe edgelords) or joining a community discord(new members generally just get ignored and talked over by veterans posting memes).  

I spent four hours trying to survive for longer than 41s without getting either sniped by an equipped player or rushed at and skull caved in by 3 other butt naked new spawns.  Which was two hours longer than I probably should've.  Honestly, though, I'm not even going to request a refund - because it's really not about *my* $40 at this point - it's about saving others from making the same mistake and wasting *their* $40 and time on what is effectively a closed community that does not really allow for new players.  

TL;DR: DO NOT BOTHER PURCHASING/TRYING TO PLAY THIS GAME IF YOU DO NOT ALREADY KNOW HOW TO PLAY & HAVE IG FRIENDS WHO CAN TAKE YOU IN & PROVIDE PROTECTION.  Unless, of course, you specifically enjoy spending $40 just to spawn in, have barely enough time to maybe knock down a tree or two, get killed by a rando and repeat over and over again.

I am a 50 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 19 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his brother , so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he send me a server for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son Goku many happy memories.

Rust Log August 2022:

Spawned on a beach with a rock, torch and no clothes. So someone who looked friendly... Said Hi and was shot. As I was down they called me the N-Word and bashed my head in with a rock. 

Spawned again. This time I ran into a forest. Was instantly shot from some guy on a roof in the distance. Crawled for a bit before being eaten by a wolf. 

Spawned yet another time. This time I managed to build an stone hatchet and pick axe. Used them to farm some materials and built a small shed out of wood only to be surrounded by the locals. I survived their first attack and hid in my shed. Started hearing bottles breaking and fire around my shed... Got roasted like a marshmellow. All my stuff taken or destroyed.

Spawned for the fourth time. Built my base again and this time upgraded it to stone. Took most of the day but finished it. Logging off.

Woke up today and started rust. After logging in my stuff is gone. There is a different door on my base. I appear to be trapped. Nothing left to do but suicide. Started a new base. Started talking **** in chat afterwards. Got a positive response... I think the locals may be accepting me. 

Started today by talking ****. Learned of something called a trap base on youtube. Decided I am going to try to build one.

Finished my trap base...First victim decided to scout it out. When he jumped in he landed on my cactus. I shot and killed him... Took his stuff and called him the N-Word. Things are improving...

Been a couple days since my trap base design... Havent showed up for work. My boss called. I told him to get rekt. I now have more time to play Rust. Trap base has been coming along. I dont even bother to use any of the other mechanics in the game. I just run around and kill people for items. I had someone invite me into their team and discord.

Been playing for a few more days with this team. Now we have moved to our 3rd server. Got a whole new meta to the game. Now we login, create bases, and "roof camp farmbots", as the locals call it, for supplies. If things dont go our way we move on to the next server like locusts. 

This will be my last post for a while as my power is getting shut off. I will be moving back in with my parents. I have begun to **** in a bag so that I can use it in a composter. I am hoping to start to create manuer to sell for scrap. I figured I could use the materials to build my own place. My parents are looking at me funny while I was over. When the amazon guy knocked on the door I told them we needed to place more barricades because the next time we could be raided when I move in. They arent listening to me. They said they wanted me to "see someone." I told them that I would as soon as I am done making my satchel charges. I have been watching their neighbor eyeing my future house. I am going to offline him when he goes in to work. Will post details later...

Get a whole family of people that scream like Tyler1 and you get an average squad in Rust. Constant kids screaming the N-Word and a place where the inbred can finally feel like they belong. You either beat 'em or join 'em and I recommend that you don't join them. If you allow it this game will take over your life, as you see by the constant negative reviews with over 1000+ hours in game, thankfully I didn't get dragged too deep. To truly be successful in game you need to constantly have someone online and defending base or grinding. That's IF you can find someone that'll commit to dying for hours straight and being degraded. Afterwards you have a misguided chance at getting geared and building an ugly ass base. This game can feel rewarding at times but its misguided and will just drag you in for more pain. If you're a masochist that likes the feeling of having everything taken away while you sleep I 100% recommend. If not, you'll sleep better without this game in your life.

This game, can be summarized as a unforgiving, hardcore, sandbox combat and action game. It's a game where you have to fight for your life, every day, because of the toxicity, combat skills, and raids from players. This sounds like its going to be the worst time of your life to play the game, and immediately refund it.

BUT, somehow... The game is enjoyable, repeatable, challenging, daring, engaging, and unique. The systems and mechanics within the game, the toxic people within it, the accessibility for creativity within a post-apocalyptic, aggressive, hardcore theme and setting, it allows you to have a new experience each time, and repeat what you do, in a different way, each time. Rust is like a randomly generated first person sandbox PVP survival game, where its merciless and you can learn on your own. If you make accomplishments, it feels genuinely rewarding, in addition to the game providing community-made and moddable servers, to fit your liking, and enjoy it the way you like it.

I'd rate it as one of my most favourite and replayable games. One thing to note, though, is the only thing that's a genuine problem is the performance, and optimization for the game. You're going to need quite a bulky PC, and you're kinda going to have to bear with the frame drops. Otherwise, have fun surviving! (Or trying to!)

I was afraid and ran away from the most dangerous location, and there I spotted this random black man gazing at each other, wondering what we should do to one other for fear of killing each other.  We pleaded not to murder and began to thrive for survival together since that time. We began searching for basic supplies in order to construct our first home. We awkwardly stared at each other nude, debating if we should create a separate 1x1 room for both of us. We followed the same procedure every day after that, unaware that there was more to learn. 

One day, this man proposed to me, and I eagerly accepted to be his wife. I grew my guts with this man, gradually leaving fear behind me, and I killed many. With this husband, we built the best first biggest stronghold and a well protected house ever known to humanity, making it difficult for raiders to figure out what the fuck is going on, what to do, or how to raid our place.

This game is not made for people who like to play games alone. Unless you have a team of fifteen people to play with then your going to have a rough time in this game. Playing Rust solo is pretty much dying simulator unless your willing to put in hundreds of hours. I gave this game a try because I heard good things about it, but from my experience it very difficult in ways that are just not fun. From Youtube videos I watched, playing with friends seems very enjoyable, but my God, do not buy this game and play solo without knowing much about the game. I wouldn't be so hard on this game if it wasn't $40, even though it has similar format to free-to-play battle royale games. In short, don't buy thing game unless you have alot of friends who are willing to play this game with you for several hours.

I'm going to give a straight, and serious review of the game. Rust is by no means a bad game, I'd say the only downsides of playing Rust is that it's a game that requires a decent dedication of your time, and the player base is another downside. About 100% of the servers you go on will have someone who is toxic on it if your playing well populated servers but don't let them ruin your experience. I've found if you find some cool friends and just ignore everyone but your team its actually possible to have a lot of fun. To add onto this, the developers have been maintaining this game for some time now, with regular updates to the game adding new features and balancing the game I'd have to say that they showed more effort than 80% of the studio releases this year. In conclusion I believe that Rust is a fun game, but it can also be hell due to the toxic player base that you are bound to run into. 
Tip: Just ignore the toxic people, chances are they come on here for attention

I will be fast and clear with my review. I started playing Rust around summer 2020 with a friend. Simply one of the best survival games out there! Here are my pros and cons.

Pros:
- enormous player base
- beautiful graphics and smooth gameplay
- can play with friends
- weapons and clothing customization
- unique base building
- a lot of PVP action
- raiding enemy player bases
- different type of servers ( modded, vanilla, community, etc.)
- day and night cycle
- every month the game has a major update and all servers wipe
- large maps filled with monumets, caves, icebergs, ships, animals and more


Cons:
- you can get OFFLINE raided
- time consuming (especially if you want to play solo)
- weapon recoil requires dedication and practice (especially the AK)
- if you want to play solo get ready to be wrecked during your first 100 - 200 hours
- to craft items you need to find and learn blueprints (also time consuming af)
- you can get randomly kicked out of a server because of a TIMED OUT connection
- requires a decent gaming PC
- FPS optimization lacks in some zones of the map

I hope this review will help you!

Running across the beach me and a friend see a man on the other side of a lake, completely stripped naked brandishing nothing but an ak building a base that looked far too large for one man only. 

The naked takes notice of us on the other side of the lake and decides to shoot at us missing all but a few shots, obviously me and my friend surprised by the fact they were picking a fight against people who were not only adorned much more advanced and protective gear but had enough explosives to transform his base of twig and stone into a crater rivaling the one that wiped out the dinosaurs. 

Despite this fact me and my friend decide to bide our time, instead of running over to him completely overwhelm him in a firestorm of bullets and then proceeding to dump enough rockets into his base to cause another Cuban missile crisis, we played angry birds, but instead of birds we had rockets and instead of pigs we had the naked and his base. We launched various rockets at different heights across the lake, the ones that hit took out most of his twig scaffolds, at times he even tried repairing them to no avail as we mercilessly launched more rockets immediately demolishing anything he'd attempt to build, it was the most fun i ever had on this game. Although for a brief moment of self reflection I've realized what I've become, before buying this game i had everything going for me i was happy with what i had, this game has changed me in such a way that i only got enjoyment out of the suffering of others, all to typical for a rust player i thought to myself.

The period of self reflection was cut all to short when another player with an ak snuck up to see the commotion and opened fire on us when our backs were turned instantly killing me and downing my friend, surprisingly after explaining what we were doing the player decided to revive my friend and join us, we gave him a rocket launcher with a few rockets and let him go at the poor naked. What the guy who killed us didn't know though was my base was right next to where he killed me and upon respawning and telling my friend to stall for time i grabbed an ak, went on my roof and shot him dead, the only person who would even consider hearing us out and showed mercy on us, i killed him. Do i regret it? No, it's every man for himself and if you find yourself showing mercy to people thinking your having a positive impact on the community like the person who showed mercy on us you'll find yourself stabbed in the back sooner or later wishing you'd never res'd that naked on the beach.

all in all my KD went from about 1.5 to 1.75 so i'd say it was worth it 10/10

This is a great survival game. There are many things you can do and the gameplay gives you a lot of freedom. There are a lot of active players and the community is very toxic but it is part of the game. I recommend playing with friends for a great experience and enjoying the game. A wipe is carried out every week / month in order to continue making the game playable for everyone and to feed the addiction of the players. The price is right but it is very likely that you can also get it at a sale. There are some minor bugs and glitches but overall the game experience is great.

Rust is a multiplayer-only survival video game developed by Facepunch Studios. Rust was first released in early access in December 2013 and received its full release in February 2018. Rust is available on Microsoft Windows and macOS. Console versions for PlayStation 4 and Xbox One being developed in conjunction with Double Eleven were released in May 2021. Rust was initially created as a clone of DayZ, a popular mod for ARMA 2, with crafting elements akin to those in Minecraft.

The objective of Rust is to survive in the wilderness using gathered or stolen materials. Players must successfully manage their hunger, thirst, and health, or risk dying. Despite the presence of hostile animals such as bears and wolves, the primary threat to the player is other players due to the game being solely multiplayer. Combat is accomplished through firearms and various weapons, such as bows. In addition, vehicles controlled by non-player characters will occasionally roam, attacking armed players. Rust features crafting, though initially limited until the discovery of specific items in the game's open world. To stay protected, players must build bases or join clans to improve their chance of survival. Raiding is a major aspect of Rust. Rust supports modded servers which can add additional content.

Rust was first released in December 2013 to the Steam Early Access program. During this period of development, the gameplay was changed significantly. Dangerous wildlife replaced zombies as the primary environmental threat and several fundamental revisions to the crafting system were released, along with general improvements and feature additions. While in Early Access, Rust was ported to the Unity 5 game engine, providing substantial graphical changes. The game also introduced immutable, predetermined skin colour and biological sex tied to players' Steam account details. Despite being fully released, the game continues to receive updates.

Throughout Rust's alpha release, critical reviews were mixed, with many comparisons made to other survival games. Rust was commonly explained as being a mixture of DayZ and Minecraft. During this period, reviewers frequently noted the game's unfinished nature. During its pre-release phase, critics praised the concept and gameplay and by March 2017, Rust had sold over five million copies. After leaving Early Access, it received mixed reviews from critics. The player vs player combat and survival aspects were highlighted by those who enjoyed the game, though reviewers were critical of the harsh beginner experience and the constant need to grind for materials. The game has continued to be successful post-release and has been listed as one of the best survival games.

This game is a love hate relationship, I love the crafting system and PVE aspect, but full loot PVP is too full-on given the grind involved. Add to this fact that bases can be raided and taken from you, and that you are only ever one death away from spawning naked armed with a rock and owning nothing.

Unfortunately the current rule set seems to attract a toxic player base who are happy to use an AR to gun down a stone age player who has just spawned and is only carrying a rock. It is for these reasons that I cannot recommend Rust in its current state, but with a few changes to the PVP rule set, it has the potential to be an amazing game.

For as long as this game has been out, the bugs have never really been squashed, the load time is atrocious and needs optimization. Facepunch Studio's needs their own game engine and not rely upon Unity 3-D to do its dirty work. Their NPC needs some work, to act more human and not have laser pinpoint aim. 

The outposts need to stop targeting you outside of its tight perimeter, if mining or hunting you get the warning of deadly force even outside of the location, that needs to stop.

Easy Anti Cheat breaking the game every now and then and really bad optimized (some people getting 60 fps and stuttering with RTX 3070).
PS: if you need help with technical issues do not contact Facepunch support team, they send you an automatic reply then if you reply back they just ghost you.

Obviously, I'm one of those people that thought Rust was only for the gigachads, the people who have 10K hours and mastered every gun spray and every perfect arrow projectile. 

While that is closer to the truth in PVP servers, Rust is the first "Multiplayer Survival Crafting Open World" that has enough systems in it to make PVE gameplay actually good! I can go on a modded PVE server and have the time of my life, even with all the loot at 1X and having to play the game almost entirely vanilla, minus the PVP. 

So, if you're like me and not into the PVP but love everything else about this game, try to give it a try in a PVE server.

My only dislike would be the fact that the game seems to stride further from survival and more into PVP, but there are multiple community servers that you can choose from to match your playstyle.

I am a 33 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 9 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

In the game Rust, there are 5 primary activities you will be doing. Farming, Building, Solving Monument Puzzles, Researching the tech tree, and last but most importantly PVP. This is by no means a PVE game and you should not go into this game with anything in mind other than PVP. Everything you do in this game is working towards the goal of end game gear and a safe base to protect said gear. 

This game can be played as a solo or as a group, however I would strongly recommend you find a nice group of people and play with them starting off. Solo is a near impossible task in this game simply because of the high skill curve. Your first group will likely be dysfunctional and obnoxious, however you will not be able to find a skilled and competent team with at least 1000 hours. 

I recommend this game simply because it is a lot of fun once you overcome the hurdle of experience. You can dedicate literal days to a wipe and then start all over again. If Rust is good at one thing, it is the balance of progression and server wipes. Rust has made the game customization to server owners allowing the community to find the perfect equilibrium. If anything, the devs listen to the community.

BUY WITH CAUTION IF YOU HAD TO CHOOSE THIS GAME OR SOMETHING ELSE, for all else who are RICH BOYS ignore this review and carry on with your more money than sense.
You must understand these topics before you decide to buy this:
1. This game contains aim hacks that the devs (developers of the game) can't/won't address, I'm willing to bet good money that he NEVER WILL.
2. I've been with this since the start, so this has been well over five years of me waiting to post a review. The original system for the "cupboard" (the box inside your base which determines who gets build rights) was better. You are now forced to place it ground level. Long story short (other issues along with it) what use to take DAYS for someone to breach me, now takes 15 minutes TOPS. I have wasted many hours beyond what the steam counter says working up builds. etc.
3. Whoever did the guns for this game must've been a middle school aspiring genius that understood physics and damage at a high school level. Essentially, ITS TRASH.
4. This game is a project, guided by one man, who has more money than sense. This is his toy, and he has clearly stated in the past that he will work on it and do as he wishes, WHENEVER he wishes.
5. THIS GAME IS NOT FOR ANYONE UNDER THE AGE OF 10. LITERALLY. Contains nudity, and you leave your child at the disposal of grown adults and foul mouthed/attitude like children.
NOW... we got that out of the way. It's a way to hang out with friends and do stupid things and laugh together. Survival is a major part of this, whether you be the hoarder or the man always on the go, there is more than one way to do all of this. Not for the feint of heart, not for those who play games on easy mode, and your first mistake in Rust... will always be trust. Expect tons of people ready to kill you on sight. There is no such thing as end game, as the spoiled rotten dev forces us to wipe once every 1 to 3 months. So ALLL that pickle ricking you did to make this twig into a fortress of solitude... has been wiped. When you log off, your character lays down right where he/she stands, and that's it... you are wide open to whatever from there on. If this sounds like your cup of tea, then go ahead. It had TONS of potential in the beginning, but now I only log in once every year or so... just to see if the dev ever decides to give a shift.

Rust is a griefer's paradise. There’s nothing quite like finding a guy sleeping in a forest and looting him before he wakes up, or camping outside another player’s fort and killing her when she opens the door. For those who enjoy deadly games of cat and mouse, Rust might just be the best survival game out there. But anybody more interested in building and exploration, or isn’t able to devote themselves to one game, may have a rough time.
One of the best games around Steam!

Rust is truly a fun game. Sure there CAN be some toxic people, but I have loved every moment of playing it. It feels more natural to have friends to play along side, but playing solo is just as fun as you meet others online. A lot of communities are super friendly and are willing to help new players. This is my 1000 hr review. This game will make you want to punch things. It’s not an easy game and it’s always a grind. But still sit back and farm a little. Especially when you loose a fight. Sit back and farm until you feel better, and by then you’d farmed back what you lost. You will always loose to someone who’s better than you has more monument knowledge then you and knows better angles. Good headphones are key. And practice on an aim train server if you actually want a chance. It will take hundreds of hours before you start getting higher tier loot on vanilla servers. Overall addicting and fun but god is easy anti cheat trash. You will run into hackers but don’t always assume people are hacking… I’ve seen people do crazy shit because they were good not because they were hacking. This is my 1000hr review I will continue to make these as I go.

I am a 44 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 12 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Game mechanics are great and most things seem well thought out. Of course, managing things like hunger and water are challenging but I think they did an okay job. But if I think that, why am I leaving a negative review? Because it's only online, you HAVE to interact with the players, which makes the game suck. The fact it's online only sucks, but more so the player base is a bunch of rude idiots with no regard for beginners; I played solo and died over twenty times, and only ONCE did I get enough wood and stone, essential resources BTW, to make a stone axe! This brings me to another complaint, resource prevalence. When playing on a server, unless you're the first few people in, you won't be able to find any resources to get started. Stone is already scarce because not all stone is minable but you need it for almost everything, and if you come in later, someone else has built their base nearby and will kill you if you get near it! The game mechanics don't break the game, the people who can't figure out that not everyone wandering in the world nude because they can't yet build clothes is a threat. Figure out why your game is unplayable by PLAYING IT. Also, add an offline/local play mode. Because I need to be able to play somehow.

My review will be short and to the point. Rust was one of the first games I ever played with a friend back in the summer of 2017. One of the best survival games ever made! Here are some of my advantages and disadvantages.

Pros:

- a massive user base

- stunning visuals and fluid gameplay

- Supports multiplayer gaming

- personalization of weapons and clothing

- Construction of a distinctive foundation

an abundance of PvP

- Invading the bases of rival players

variety in the server type ( modded, vanilla, community, etc.)

the daily and nightly rhythm of life

- Each month, the game receives a significant update, resulting in a server wipe.

maps with numerous landmarks, caves, icebergs, shipwrecked creatures, and much more.





Cons:

- You may be raided OFFLINE.

- a lengthy process (especially if you want to play solo)

Reducing the impact of a weapon's recoil takes commitment and practice (especially the AK)

playing solo for the first 100-200 hours can be mentally and physically draining, so be prepared for that.

find and learn blueprints in order to make items (also time consuming af)

TIMED OUT connections can cause you to be booted from a server at random.

A high-end gaming PC is needed for this.

- Some areas of the map have poor FPS optimization.



If this review helps you, please let me know in the comments below.

My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.
