a game where the toxic playerbase is a feature; people will wish ill on your family, call you the worst things in a multitude of languages, purposefully ruin hours or even days or hard work....

....and it's brilliant. in this way, Rust turns even your nicest, most well-intentioned person into someone willing to do what it takes to steal everything from these players. It has no real drivers like plot or much structure outside of the core loop, and yet has a very dedicated following, with people averaging either a dozen hours, or thousands. it's a good game. 

-Because you are pitted against people who have literally tens of thousands of hours in this game, you will see and experience (and maybe even do) every type of play imagineable. sneaky grubbing, crazy headshots, having a grenade chucked at your face or chucking the grenade. the game rewards awareness and working within the confines of it's systems. basically, you can and will learn to be good. and the process is challenging, but rewarding. 


There are also different types of servers you can play on that offer unique experiences, like PvE servers where you can play the features of rust without worrying about a double-barrel behind that door. Servers where gather rates are crazy high, custom UI features, addons that allow for personal minis and cars, teleportation, to almost making rust a different game entirely. tech-limited servers so the best gun is a Python, servers designed to be on mars, or the moon, or underwater. there really is a Rust for everyone. 

And of course, not everyone you meet will be Human Trash(tm). you will occasionally find some lovely people playing the game that simply want to do their own thing, and these people shine all the brighter being studded in the sea that is the rest of the playerbase. really, i mean it - a rust for everyone. 

I do recommend watching a video or two first no matter which you play (but particularly pvp) as sometimes obviously new players will get pity after being easily decimated.....but generally, it's better to avoid that decimation in the first place. where you can. 

If you get really angry, remember it's okay to take a break and have a drink. at the end of the day, it's all a game where your progress gets reset every....well depending on the server, it could be varying levels or progress reset, and it could be every week, 2 weeks, or month. but yeah - this fact makes it really not toooooo much of a loss when you do get wrecked. You can start over, or you can go to a new server and wait until the next wipe. there's a lot of freedom to choose your own experience. 

Probably not for children under 16-17, unless you're monitoring what server they play on (which you will want to search for and test yourself to make sure. the game makes this very easy to do.) because again.....by design, it serves the core game play loop to have an absolutely horrendous player to player experience most of the time.

TL;DR list
Pros: 
-Very flexible player experience....if you know what to look for. not hard to find, though.
-Engaging gameplay; with headphones you can tell where and roughly how far something that makes noise is; and that brings you in with the need to be focused so no one catches you by surprise. 
-while the end goal is by all means "obtain Loot", and then subsequently what you do with it in order to get more, there are many playstyles that work toward this goal irregardless of server particulars. 
-the playerbase is some of the worst kids and adults you will ever interact with....and while it can be a bit much sometimes, it very cleverly drives the loop on pvp/official servers.
-Guns, arguably the most important part, are brilliantly balanced in terms of scale. While a person with a bow would almost always lose to someone with a machine gun....it IS entirely possible to use strategy or even luck to kill someone with better gear. In fact, that's the most common way to advance. it isn't meaningless at all to have better gear, but you get stronger - not invincible. 
-The game is, in fact, stunningly beautiful. there are some awkward animal animations, but the scenery is some of the best. on busy servers, having a quiet morning in-game overlooking a valley from your mountaintop base.... it's pretty good. 
-Good lord, some of the sounds in this game are so Satisfying. from firing guns to building walls, the sounds communicate a lot even outside of tactical situations. 

cons:
-The playerbase is toxic, and often go out of their way to be crude. it is a good driver of gameplay, but I can't say i find it enjoyable when someone wishes cancer on my mother because I downed them after they hit me. my hours are primarily on PvE servers, as I like the game features and those communities.

-The game is....awkward, technically speaking. it has issues running well on some of the higher end PC's, and Rust is a game where frames matter. it isn't impossible to play with some stutter, but it will severely impact your experience. Ping information is available, and should be considered when selecting a server to choose from. low ping is better, and Ping is listed next to the server name so choosing is easy. 

-also, you'll probably need to turn your settings down.

-More technical awkwardness, is that sometimes Rust systems interact in odd ways. Preventing building where a moment ago it said you could, preventing placement of objects due to meshes that are invisible, that sort of thing. Most if not all of these issues are solveable with a bit of creativity/luck, but can be infinitely frustrating as a new player with no idea of how to solve them. That's why I recommend watching some videos, just to save that frustration. 

-the game has a core loop, but no plot, story, or any sort of context. you just begin as a naked on a beach, and go from there. while i do like the simplicity, I can't deny that it's pretty bland and would probably benefit from even some partial lore information available inside the game. I have no idea if there is lore, because it isnt inside the game. of course, the lack of definition boosts the story-generation ability of the game, so it would probably be best to just do lore about individual parts. like the Cobalt company. Who the people are that drop air supplies, or at least what their stance is about naked beach people. i digress, servers can be hard to populate because rust is a social game. 

I'm going to leave it there. its not without it's flaws; however watch a video or two, select the right server for how you want to play, and you'll have an enjoyable time.

Rust was conceived as an amazingly open game with endless potential for interesting interactions between players, but was utterly overwhelmed by a meta of constant resource-grubbing PvP, leaving all of said potential as nothing but a distant memory. If you're looking for a grindy shooter where every interaction with another player is an adrenaline-inducing fight over your slowly, painstakingly obtained resources, you'll probably enjoy it.

If you are however, like me, looking for a game where you can do something weird and watch people's reactions, that's something that remains only in the past. I have many fond memories of this game - teaming up with a bunch of fresh spawns to make a human ladder to get into someone's house, constructing billboards by the roadside with shitty jokes on them, lighthouses set ablaze by dozens of campfires, or creating veritable fields of bear traps in random places and enjoying the occasional "WTF" posted in chat. My best memory of this game was when, along with a couple mates, we'd built a church by the roadside, complete with paintings of holy figures, and held a sermon on a Sunday afternoon, causing a ceasefire as about twenty curious people participated in our shenanigans. Nowadays I don't think such a thing is possible anymore. The church would be shot at and raided, stripped of resources and instantly forgotten as another ruined base as soon as we'd open the doors.

Don't get me wrong, I've spent plenty of time enjoying the team-based survival-esque shootout gameplay, but over time it grows stale. The first few times you fight with an entire inventory full of precious loot at stake, it causes your heart to beat fast, hands to shake and stands out among other games for inducing raw emotion into the fight, primordial fear of loss and elevating joy of triumph. But eventually that too becomes routine, and all you end up with is just a game where instead of shooting at someone multiple times a minute like in any other FPS, here it's a couple times an hour, and where instead of just respawning you must also grind your time away to be ready for the next shootout. It turns what was once the buildup to a memorable fight into a few more hours of your life gone, spent performing tasks as repetitive as an accountant's livelihood, with occasional moments of short-lived fun.

As it stands this game is just not worth the time it demands of you.

This game was great. A little bit of everything. Vehicles, farming, grinding, pvp & pve. Guns and bows. Fireworks and everything in between. 

The game was incredibly rewarding from early to late game. First scrap pile to the waking up killed by a raider. Everything felt fantastic about this game, and even someone like me, whom is trash at pvp, found this game amazing!

Then it all changed when the recoil change attacked. The guns WERE great. Each rewarding when you finally learned the pattern of it. And were able to finally use them for once. Each being much different than the last. AK and LR were very different patterns, and even similar guns, such as Custom and Thompson were very different patterns.
Learning the patterns was part of the game. It was a challenge, a drive to learn them. So that you can be better and become that top tear player one day.
But now it's horrid. Someone whos never touched a single gun in this game can no very easily win against someone who has 8k+ hours. This is incredible. Theres no more challenge, nor reward for learning the pattern, none of this anymore. The rewarding nature that was once here before this update was gone in a flash. 

At the end of the day, this was a great rewarding game. Though to anyone whom may be reading this. I don't recommend this game anymore. Not until this new change is reverted. And if you do still buy this game, for gods sake turn your walls around.

I just first want to start and say I have been playing rust since 2018 always have played for long periods and then came back. I have almost 4k hours and would consider myself a very good player with both game knowledge and being good at sprays. I fell in love with the game from how hard it was to grasp and how different it was from every other game needing countless hours to be better than someone else pure skill. I would say In the past two years there has been a lot more activity with updates than before with face punch almost throwing up content update after update the game was perfect for a very long period of time without any content updates with a beautiful community. Now don't get me wrong change is not bad it's nice to have new stuff now and then to keep interested and to grab people's attention but I feel like it started to get to the point where it was too much. the train update was cool and new and I was very excited about it but then they added underwater labs and just way too many ways to collect loot almost splitting everyone apart from having to fight for loot. It was to the point where I feel like I could hop in a server and complete a wipe in just around a couple of hours just giving that new player base an easy entry that we never had. It was still the old rust tho still hard in ways with game knowledge and sprays having to still have skill. With this recent update, tho I have had enough implementing an RNG-based spray for every gun with only 20% of bullets being part of the spray is absolutely trash RNG is in my opinion one of the worst things getting implemented into all these games and taking away from actually needing the skill to keep up. Yes, the spray patterns are easy now but RNG on top of them just completely ruins it. I have had enough with face punch and the direction they are taking the game they are money hungry and I can't even call this game rust anymore just does not feel the same...

This game used to be an addicting cancer, but was still awesome because of the steep learning curve, and the in depth game play that mixed positioning and skill. Even if you weren't the best shot, you could still win a few gunfights, and there were LOADS of other ways to have fun and contribute. However, The new recoil updates are ASS. You get beamed faster than hackers in warzone (which Facepunch has still NOT FIXED. THERE IS STILL A MAJOR HACKING PROBLEM). With no damage reduction from how the game used to be, and a new craftable LMG that is so unbelievably cheap to craft (basically takes a fingernail, a water bottle, and a cardboard box), rust has evolved from a unique gameplay experience where game knowledge was key, and turned itself into a wannabe COD copy.

Edit: The gunplay is not as unbalanced as it once was, but my review above still stands. Too many hackers which facepunch will still not address, and the TTK is way to low.

Recently I have decided to quit Rust following their recent update. I have spent nearly 3,000 hours on Rust since late 2015-2016. The game changed to quickly and doesn't feel like the game I grew up playing. Everything was changed to cater newer players; which included changing in-game recoil to be insanely simple and to be more RNG based. People spent thousands of hours and years of their life playing this amazing game just to have the great Rust feel ripped out from underneath them in one push of a button.

Don't get me wrong I still recommend Rust because of its amazing community, its been awesome seeing it grow and all the things people have done to raise money for charities and to make people aware. I wish luck to any new players that want to enjoy Rust like I have the last few years. It will be easier for newer people to enjoy because the pvp aspect is so simple now. Rust is going to keep growing but mainly without its OG player base.

The devs care insanely about their game and the monthly updates for the last couple of years show that. Rust will continue to grow and maybe become one of the most played steam games these next few months.

I hope everyone can make some great memories like I have playing and I wish them luck to the intense rush inducing world of Rust.

Rust is in its 8th year and has now had over 300 content updates, with a guaranteed content patch every month. From regular balance fixes and improvements to AI and graphics updates to adding content like new maps, musical instruments, trains and drones, as well as regular seasons and events, there’s always something interesting or dangerous (or both) happening on the island. Updates to the game include:

Procedurally generated worlds with map editor support
Host your own servers and with server-side modding support
Vehicles: horses, modular cars, hot air balloons, helicopters, trains and more
Complex electrical systems
Farming
New enemies, wildlife and factions
New monuments and areas to explore
Gestures and contact system
Musical instruments
Large train network
Huge recent graphics overhaul
..and more
EXPLORE

You wake naked on a mysterious island armed only with a rock and a torch. You’ll need to brave natural dangers (from heat and cold to thirst and starvation), build a shelter, eat (or be eaten), scavenge materials. Explore the island, its abandoned settlements, mysterious monuments and the factions that occupy them. But, above all, watch out for other survivors...
BUILD

Design and build bases to defend your territory or control the resources of the island. Research the tech tree, grow farms, command electricity, commandeer vehicles from horses to cars to boats to helicopters. Whatever it takes to get ahead.
SURVIVE

There are no rules in Rust but the ones you make for yourself. Craft tools, armor and weapons to defend yourself. Cooperate with friends and allies and build a town together. Explore the island and what’s happening in it. Trade with other players. Or prey on them, raiding their bases and taking their hard-won goods.
MATURE CONTENT DESCRIPTION
The developers describe the content like this:

Contains violence and caveman themed nudity.

In-game nudity, blood, player-made signs, voice chat and text chat can be disabled from the in-game options menu.

Recently I have decided to quit Rust following their recent update. I have spent nearly 12,000 hours on Rust since late 2015-2016. The game changed to quickly and doesn't feel like the game I grew up playing. Everything was changed to cater newer players; which included changing in-game recoil to be insanely simple and to be more RNG based. People spent thousands of hours and years of their life playing this amazing game just to have the great Rust feel ripped out from underneath them in one push of a button. 

Don't get me wrong I still recommend Rust because of its amazing community, its been awesome seeing it grow and all the things people have done to raise money for charities and to make people aware. I wish luck to any new players that want to enjoy Rust like I have the last few years. It will be easier for newer people to enjoy because the pvp aspect is so simple now. Rust is going to keep growing but mainly without its OG player base.

The devs care insanely about their game and the monthly updates for the last couple of years show that. Rust will continue to grow and maybe become one of the most played steam games these next few months.

I hope everyone can make some great memories like I have playing and I wish them luck to the intense rush inducing world of Rust. 

                                           -Ronnie Mcdonalds

I used to like Rust. 

The issue with Rust now is that most of the skill ceiling is gone. Imagine a world where the AK recoil is the easiest to control. Well we are living in that world. I used to love this game because I had to go onto training servers and get good with each of the guns recoil. Now the AK recoil is basically a straight line. The MP5 spray turned stupid and so did the LR spray.

I can't understand why they focused on a new major combat update and not performance update. I get around 90-120fps when I play Rust on my PC. I have a 3090 and an AMD Ryzen 9 5900x. I can run basically any game on 200+fps on the highest settings but on rust I can't. It has to be miserable for people with lower end specifications to play rust. 

I do understand why they did this update it's so the new players have it easier. But they didn't think of the older Rust players who have 100s if not 1000s of hours on this game who have countless hours on training servers to get their spray to be perfect. And I don't believe that Rust was a game that was meant for new players to be immediately good at. If you wanted to play Rust you would have to practice unlike other FPS games. That's why Rust had a large loyal player base. It's sad to see that they made this update because so many people have now lost their hours in this game so that new players can be good at it. Why couldn't they just and servers with this update so that the people who had 100s and 1000s of hours could continue to play the game they have always loved. 

I know I don't have that many hours many people have a lot more than me but I still have 600 hours in this game. This update only helps new players and is going to make the older players have to start over and learn most of the game again. And the sounds are so fucked. 

This update is going to stop scripting. NO IT ISN'T everyone who has made scripts for Rust probably have already updated them. So now the people who used to be able to fight scripters because they had skill with the different sprays they can't do that anymore. And a crosshair why add a fucking crosshair and hit registration to the game. If you want hit registration go on a 100x server and play not a fucking main server. And now when you get hit you are going to see where you are hit from.

If you were to ask me 2 years ago if i would recommend this game i would 1000x say yes. It was at a perfect state, we were a large community but still a niche community with different type of players and people. But no matter what you could always find PvP or raid, a server to control, offliners to get revenge on. 

Ive played over 8,000 hour on this game (different accounts), ive spent money time sleep health on this game since 2019, I have watched it make the same mistake every developer studio seems to make now adays. They cater more towards the streamers, redditers and stop listening to the people who made their game popular. the people who DO spend thousands of hours and money and time and sleep on their games. I feel like my side of the community has been pushed away with this new recoil crossing the line. I know i quit because of this and i know MANY of my 10k+ hour friends have as well. Its a sad day and a small part of me hopes that in months time when the game is dead, when the streamers move on. They will realize the mistake they made.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I played for a while and wound up really liking the building and gunplay, I have spent most of my hours on this game inside of pvp servers to practice my recoil and I got it down where I could spray over 125 meters with the ak and mp5, I also worked on other guns but I wanted to be really good with those two. I had so much fun but when I logged on today with the thought of the recoil changing I got sad but still thought it might be atleast some what good. I logged on and crashed twice, then proceed to load into ukn where I went straight to the aimbots, I looked around and it felt very weird at first but I thought "whatever it just feels a little different", Boy was I wrong, when I tried the spray, I felt very displeased in facepunch for doing such a thing. The recoil was the most competitive thing in this game and it seemed like it all went away in an instant, I am very sad that facepunch would do this. I will also sadly be uninstalling this game until it is fixed or it is staying uninstalled forever. Thank you for your time.

Probably the best game I ever played, but I cannot recommend it after the 6/2/2021 update. Why? Because they fucked up the competitive PVP it had. I stopped playing because of how many scripters there were playing in any good pop server, and when I first learned that they were planning to change recoils I thought it was because of that. Problem is, it wasn't, the new recoils aren't random, they are just patterns, as the last ones were, but these patterns are EXTREMELY easier (crouched). So the scripters will be there anyway, but now the skill gap went down HARD, and to put things worse, the aimcone (bullets not going where you are aiming in burst/full-auto) is unbearable.

I was really excited to come back and play the game again without scripters, turns out everybody is a scripter now (because gunplay is easy as hell)

Facepunch took the skill aspect of the game and the enjoyment of getting better out with this new recoil that now lets anyone beam one another. They changed the gun sounds from what every liked to now you either like it or don't but thats not really what I want to express. One of the big parts of pvp in Rust was that every gun was viable and that you chose which ones you used, if you didn't like the ak recoil you could use the lr, mp5, or thommy even the sap, sar and custom each gone had its separate recoil that created variety and enjoyment. now each gun has a bland recoil that was created for "new" players who "dropped" the game due to the recoil. All I gotta say about that is if you drop a fps game bcs you don't enjoy putting time into it to learn at least one guns recoil then you shouldn't play fps games since that one of the major aspects to the genre. gonna be sad to watch Rusts pop dwindle until someone makes a mod for the modded servers creating a large seperation in the playerbase which can and will be the downfall of the game as a separation in the player base and the devs catering to those that complain on reddit killed all the games that have done that before.

In Rust, there are endless possibilities. Every time you load into a new server, the player interactions will shape the story of the game. With one clear objective: Survival. However, what if survival is not enough. You will ask yourself, "what is the meaning of life?".."I didnt scrape and crawl my way up just to live in a 2x2!..."I want more!"... The insatiable hunger for a bigger, stronger base and better weapons will drive all to push their abilities to the limits. Whether it's pvp, clearing top tier pve monuments, raiding, or just sneaking around labs to stack loot, there are endless avenues to stardom. Don't just survive.... you must thrive. This is Rust.

If you're interested in games that will challenge you in all aspects of gaming Rust is the game for you. This game will test your  ability to be sneaky, smart, tactics, player vs player, base building and overall survival. Rust is not for the light hearted or easily triggered as you will have a lot of ups and downs. The learning curve is massive and will take a while before you are able to successfully navigate wipes. After close to 1500 hours played Rust has quickly become my favorite game to play. I would highly suggest this game to anyone who is looking for that intricate survival game. 5/5

Only need to know about this game that may be make or break is the game is base off of wipes. Wipes is a time frame in which the map refreshes/changes so 1 week player would build, gather, and fight each other. Then at the end of the wipe each the map clears everything and restarts new. Maps do change just base on the sever itself. (also blueprints/ research tree for using better items) And its time frame is 1 week to 1 month. Tends to be better experince with others but still fun playing as a solo. Trust no one and have fun!

Rust has been playable since 2013, it is one of the most popular games on Steam. 

What is rust? The game follows the very classic survival approach: You start naked on the beach of an island, armed only with a stone, and you should survive. You collect resources, craft armor and weapons and build a shelter.

In large camps, happily distributed on the map, you will find better and better equipment, explore different biomes and complexes or fight against other players who are sometimes the greatest danger. Rust is one of our best survival games for PC, Xbox and PlayStation because of its many possibilities and its active community.

However, Rust is considered a rough patch. You are little or not taken by the hand, you have to learn a lot yourself and most of it through pain. Almost all veterans say: if you want to play Rust, you have to be prepared to die.

I wish you all the best of luck :)

They should have made another game instead of turning Rust into a game with the difficulty level of bloons TD.

I paid for the game way back in alpha stages. Great game. When it "released" i said fine, thats the game. But over the last 1.5 years, they have eliminated what makes their maps great for PVP and solo gameplay. 

For when the player is shot, They added "being down" when you should be dead, and you can crawl around when down, and close base doors. As an agressor in fights, this is rediculous to deal with. 3 headshots to kill someone naked, or if you dont hit the head, theyll go into a crawling state and crawl back into their base, politely closing the door behind them.

As of May 26 2022, They are completely removing gun recoil spray patterns, single handedly alienating their core player base who practice to have the skill to out-shoot an opponent. Now the games basically like valorant. No recoil, too much bullet bloom. 

You used to need skill to kill an opponent in the game 200 meters away by controlling your spray. 
But even if you shoot like you have scripts, the bullet bloom is so high, dont even waste your time pulling the trigger to shoot.

FACEPUNCH. YOURE CHANGING THE FUNDAMENTALS OF THE GAME WE ENJOY. GO MAKE A DIFFERENT GAME WITH ALL YOUR GREAT IDEAS.

I hope your datacenter servers burn down again, like they did last year and you didnt keep backups.

Oh and by the way, when you get killed in the game (at least before May 26 2022), it most likely wasnt a scripter. But ill be damned. 
If the development studio is taking this game into a new direction to cater to the more casual player, youre going to see an influx of cheaters enjoying the game with all these farm bot players running around. You know, the cheaters that use ESP, jump 2.5x normal jump height, etc. Ban them? nahhh.

new accounts with Rust cost around 2-5$, if players are legit cheating and determined, youre not going to have a good time. Play on community servers with active admins, thats the only way.
Hardware bans are circumvented with ease when cheaters use cheats that cost 80+$ a month. Sometimes they even spend 500$ a month for god tier cheats, and if theyre careful, theyll rarely get caught. 

I hate this cheating bullshit, but playing rust, you have to understand some people will, and now with these updates catering toward a more casual crowd who just farm, itll be a cheaters heaven. 
And now im gunna step back and get my popcorn.

Not only punishes the people who actually got good at the game with the old system, but also the new recoil removes any skill gap whatsoever. You can spend hours with the new game to get better, yet you will stil lose to a far worse player just because he will crouch in a bush and spray&pray and you will miss your shots because of the random aspects of the new recoil patterns. The old sounds were also far better, more crisp and satisfying.

Really good game so far from what I've played. The frames can drop at some points like when your in outpost/bandit. Considering that Facepunch is an indie development company, this game is much better than most AAA games which is impressive. With the new PVP update coming out soon, I think that the game will die and a lot of people will leave which I don't blame them. The skill gap for the new recoils will decrease so much that Rust will feel like it will be too easy for everyone and Bob the farmer can probably spray 100m with only a couple hours practice. The aimcone has been nerfed massively on staging to a point where you can't even spray over 125 meters which is insane. With that being said about the update, it is 'Subject to change' so they may not even roll out with the update. The sounds as they are right are perfect, each gun has a unique sound as so can be easily identified and the hit sounds like the crunch for a headshot is so satisfying that FP shouldn't change a thing. I know that they have to change the recoil in some way to freshen up the game so it doesn't die from all the scripters. However, they made the recoils on staging too easy and the aimcone is awful. In terms of cheaters, they did say that the upcoming update is not purposed to counter this which is understandable. Overall, I think FP should either keep the game as it is to keep everyone happy or come up with new recoils that are on par with the current ones so that the game is still fresh whilst also being good.

I have played this game for 4100 hrs by far and away the most time I have put on any game. Until now I would say its my favorite game of all time but I can no longer say this. There are many things I like about Facepunch but at heart I now truly believe they are cowards. They won't pick a script and stick with it. I play with a group of players who all have atleast 1500 hours in the game and we are very good and came up the hard way..putting in the time and effort to get good at this game. We learned to get good at the game by learning the guns and practicing them....Alot.... with the roll out of this coming patch and taking away the skill we've spent countless hours perfecting I can't help but feel this is about taking from those who saw the way to be top tier and then followed through and giving it to the masses. You robbed us Facepunch. So now I can say for sure that my group of friends who together have over 10k hours on rust will be moving to a new game Tarkov, or Scum, or Dayz. It bothers me that you basically sold out your dedicated player base Facepunch in the interest adding training wheels to the game. TLDR: Was a fun game if you put the time in but developers have become sell outs. HERE IS A WORKING WAY TO CHANGE THAT (WORKING 5/27/2022)

Step > 1
- Click on the "Library" tab at the top of your steam client.

Step > 2
- Search for "Rust" on the left side of your steam library.
Step > 3
- Right click the game and hover over "Manage".
Step > 4
- An extra tab should show up to the side, now navigate to "Uninstall" and click it.
Step > 5
- Confirm your choice.

They actually fixed the gun play with the new recoil changes. Any sudden negative reviews you see regarding this update are cheaters, angry that the scripts they pay for won't give them an advantage with the new randomized recoil and additional dispersion of bullet trajectory. They have fixed a core issue that has been plaguing the community for far too long. 

Additional information for review reading gamers: Do not let anyone convince you that scripts will still run rampant with the randomized recoil. In order to have the accuracy they previously had under the static pattern recoil, they will have to use aimbot hacks that are substantially easier to detect with anti-cheat, and are significantly easier to observe by admins moderating a server. Under the old static pattern recoil, it is almost impossible for admins to tell the difference between a skilled player and a script-using cheater.

Ahh Rust, A game that I love to play but hate to lose in. Rust is a game that is updated even to this day and has a multitude of ways to play it. I personally like playing in a small group, at least with one other person. For the sweatiest of people this game is a perfect home, but for the more mild manner I would steer clear. The game is definitely not for the faint of heart, one wrong move will have you lose maybe hours of work.
-----------

The Pros

- The variety of servers, procedural maps, and social interactions make this game infinitely playable
- If you are highly skilled, you can feel like a total bad ass in gunfights
- Teamwork is rewarded and you can make a variety of strange but helpful friends
- Personally, positional Voice Chat is fun as hell
- Tons of items and in game concepts to keep you busy
- Base building is very granular. Base concepts can be highly complex to maximize defense or material use. Or you can build a 1x1 wooden shack

-----------

The Middles: Stuff that maybe Pros or Cons for others. I will indicate what my preferences are)

- Zerg Clans. Personally a con for me, but for others can be a good way to socialize in abig group. Zerg Clans can dominate a server, and will make surviving a living hell. Or you can get some epic raids on Zerg vs Zerg wars.
- KOS (Kill on Sight) is common. Big Con for me, but people love to watch the world burn. People will often get enjoyment from sitting ontop of bases and sniping people from afar. Makes new players have a real hard time playing
- High Risk, High Rewards. I really like this. Nobody is invincible*, on day one you can take on a highly geared player and come out on top. Or you may get unlucky killing a boar and lose all your stuff. Work is highly impermanent
- Server wipes. The servers will wipe every so often to keep players from getting to powerful or to freshen things up. I like it, but probably not liked by all

-----------

The Cons

- Toxicity, you will find a lot of people who don't kiss their mothers
- Hacking, not a very often occurrence but is highly frustrating in this high risk/rewards setting
- High System Requirements make the game difficult to run well for a majority of people, check the recommenced specs before buying
- Gameplay can be grindy, it takes a lot of resources to make anything of permanence. As such the more people you have, the faster that grind may be
-Micro-transactions and lootboxes blow, and a few have ingame impact. Mostly cosmetic but have some quirks which can provide benefits mechanically on a number of them.

-----------

Conclusion:

While my hours (at time of writing) are 22 days worth of hours, I'm pretty shite at the game. The game is highly punishing, and I wouldn't recommend it to most people. But wait, why am I recommending it? The game itself is great, anybody who doesn't mind toxicity and have hours to burn will love the rush this game gives them. Raiding a group butt naked with a Eoka pistol is an experience I treasure deep in my heart. But for somebody who has things going on, and doesn't want to have slurs thrown at them, I wouldn't bother.

Also don't bother with the DLCs unless you want to support the Devs. They are cosmetic or gimmik items. Of course get them if you want to support the developers who work tirelessly on this game. The base game is all you need to get going

I havent seen my family in days, I cant fit through my door frame, at this point most of my room is empy mountain dew cans and greesy pizza boxes, I must go on oil rig run I must grind I cannot take my eyes off my base. RUST RUST RUST RUST RUSt

Worth $40 in it's current state.

Pros
Music : Instruments you can play with your keyboard, radios at some NPC shops, Voice chat.

Building : Auto roof corners, half block snap grid for Z level placements, frames for heat vents or vending machines not just doors and windows, 5 levels of durability upgrades, canvas for paintings, signs are paintings, paintings remain when you pick them up to move them. Turrets, traps, heaters, lights, sprinklers, rain collection, water storage, electric pumps, and grow beds, with some logic, and automation for your low maintenance pot farm. Lootable, steam marketable skins.

Combat : Getting the jump on someone makes a good tier of advantage, cover matters, aim matters, special loads like explosive and incendiary, scrap like a water pipe shotgun and modern weapons like the British L96 and the US M249. Also "boom" of improvised and professional grade. 

Gambling : Slots, a wheel thing, some tables. All around good time. 

Transport : You could ride a horse overland to a hot air balloon you take to a garage where you hid a car to drive to a train you can take to the beach where you have a boat you can use to get to your helicopter in an island safe house and finally land on your mansion in the mountains, tho maybe not in time for brunch.

Lore : Isn't rubber stamped by the devs and is mostly conjecture beyond some in game posters, radiated areas, and scattered ruins.

Fishing : Worms and grubs are bait, some fish are only good for bait, some good fish are still usable as bait. More complicated then just a timed click, gotta play the fish a bit, hear the pole stressing, stay lined up on it, tucker it out some. You can also fish up junk items, human remains, who knows what all.

Nudity : Clothing optional! Also modesty blur or RPG welded on underwear settings for the squeamish, asian, religious, and or etc.

Cons:
Music : Can't change the default tune for instruments, all out of tune the same amount, should be random in a range with some small chance of being in tune unless that amount is a really obscure lore thing I don't get. Radio is cool, needs expanded, would love to be able to do a radio show, jukeboxes, turntables, records, recording? I think I've heard two songs and that's all those radios play. 

Building:
Roof caps should maybe just be their own thing, not being able to modify structures after a set time is tedious, explosive damage against structures is not based on any reasonable logic I understand. Don't get me wrong I get the formula their applying to calculate damage I just think frags are nerfed into the ground, and explosive ammo is still ~20% better/cheaper then the next best thing for a scrap door, for example. 

Combat :

Gambling : Can always have more.

Transport : Motorcycles?

Lore : It has a lot of inspired elements and as a result of that it really needs a lot of its own footing to hold that up on. Maybe I'm old but it's like looking at a student of Lobachevskys first published work. Это воняет, давай купим права на фильм

Fishing : Size - Effort ratio may need tweaked

This game should be called Raidbro Simulator because that's basically what it is, sadly.

It's got lots of interesting features like building, vehicles, flying vehicles, PvP, hunting, crafting. Unfortunately 90% of these features don't matter. Basically every game comes down to the biggest zerg of edgelords on the server no-lifing resources and then raiding everyone else off the server.

My favourite thing to do was run a shop. That's genuinely fun, because you have a building that supplies something useful to people, you can get quite wealthy trading items people really want and you also get a bit of action defending yourself from people trying to rob you.

However, even if you just sell small items, eventually some people who just play Rust 24/7 will C4 your store for 50 scrap and it just feels like you're wasting your time.

I've actually been on servers of 100 players where 50 or so were just in one clan raiding everyone else constantly. Such groups get gear so much better than the smaller groups/solos it just gets really boring. "Oh wow, I get to fight the five guys with AKs and full metal armour with my bow again for the 50th time, so fun."

On top of that, the game really encourages this mentality of addiction. In order to be "competitive" you have to play it a stupid amount. I've known people in their 30s and 40s who were playing for 18 hours a day, every single day, with no job or real life outside the game. It's quite sad, really.

All in all, not a bad game in theory. However the community is extremely toxic and the entire game is basically just dudebros in enormous squads blowing your base up over and over so they can steal your pickaxe that they don't even need. Gets tedious.
ITS THE MOST FUN AND CHALLENGING GAME I HAVE PLAYED

I have played this game for years and years, and it has changed quite a bit through development! I'm no expert, but I've put in +800 hours thus far, and can honestly say, I LOVE this game. Prospective buyers, listen, YES, there is a learning curve, YES, the community is pretty toxic on some servers, BUT, if you find a nice server, with the right people and resource multipliers (5x to 10x max), it gets pretty fun. Get some friends together, do some raids, build massive, hyper-complex bases with electricity, go nuts running wires EVERYWHERE, find and mod cars to your heart's content, drive trains underground by subway, or above-ground on the rails, fly helicopters, sail submarines and motorboats; You can even fly around in a hot air balloon! Beyond that, there used to be a significant dearth of PvE things to do-- this has been fixed! now there are a plethora of enemy NPC-filled monuments and areas, bunkers, rail stations, underwater bases, etc.
If PvE isn't your cup of tea, you can always raid other people's bases, break down their walls and doors, and take their loot for your own. That feeling when you finally bust down that final wall to your enemy's loot room and can take all their stuff is just so... Satisfying. Alternatively, logging in to seeing your base partially destroyed and your chests empty is equally disappointing, but you can learn from your failed base builds and build better next time!

Best game I have ever played. However if you are new to the game and do not have at least 3+ friends to play with, I do not think you will enjoy the game. Rust back then was very good but now everyone scripts, plays ukn 247, offline raids, and groups are competing to get deeper (more people). Right now it feels like the game is slowly getting worse because of the way rust is being played now. Waking up to a base being offlined sucks and it happens almost all the time. Getting a start also sucks because the moment you get a 2x1 wooden shack, it will probably get door camped or raided. If you have guns, get ready to lose it to an 8 man or people who have 100x your hours. Like any other game that has been out for a long time, people are becoming a lot more sweaty and the hunger for loot that everyone has, is making the game a lot worse. Overall the game is very good but if you actually want to have fun it takes a lot of time and commitment and you need to play with people who know what there doing and are good at the game. And get ready to meet people who will literally sell their entire life savings and there house just to screw you over.

This game.... is great. it lets a lot of different people do a lot of different things and have different playstyles. as it stands right now though, even on vanilla official servers cheating/hacking is somewhat rampant and a good amount of the player base is incredibly toxic and violent. All the in game systems are really in depth and cool. its just hard to enjoy when there are people who are always going to be a million times better or have a big group all working together. My biggest gripe is that defense vs offense in this game, even when taking into consideration of being online when your base might be raided, the ball is in the offense court. i have and my friends have built quite a few really big, very well designed bases. literally with the offensive capabilities of other players being considered. and you just log in the next day and your base and all your loot is gone. because a handful of people or even just 1 person has to farm just enough sulfur to make the explosives required to break into your base, steal the resources from your base marker(the tool cabinet), and within 8-12 hours your base is gone. when you log in the base might be there... you might even retake it back. but with all your stuff gone its impossible to replace the resources needed to maintain it. imagine building a system of ww2 style trenches and bunkers. then you wake up and all your guns and ammo is gone. do you think its as effective now that you only have bows and spears again? without power tools how are you going to replace all the concrete and timbers? so even though i will keep playing it. it has caused me more heartache than pleasure so far. and if i could go back to being ignorant and never playing it. i would.

Have you ever wanted to play a survival game with base-building and pvp? 
Do you like getting your eardrums annihilated by someone else's war crime of a microphone? 
Do you, too, wish to relive the experience of Xbox parties circa 2009-2012? 
If you answered yes to 2/3 of these, then this is, probably, the game for you.

I always have fun playing this game because of the exploration and first-person experience aspects, it is amazing to just hang around. The multiplayer combat is incredibly fun, regardless of the level of social skills, or lack thereof, in people you "meet" under "friendly circumstances." It's a blast. The base-building and resource gathering is also highly enjoyable since there is a lot to do and learn. Learn how cook. Learn how to smelt. Forge meal. Forge a weapon. Forge a girlfrie--wait that last one is not on the list. 

Point is: you will love this game if you want the true Naked and Afraid Experience (TM) because, let's be honest, someone will kill you almost the moment they see you in many, many situations (especially if I am trying to steal their resources--you can not stop me random person I will never see again).

Anyways, thank you for reading my review if you have stuck around this long, if you could not already tell through my masterful levels of subtly, I like this game.

This is a fun game, but I wish that there were some true noob servers where those who have under a certain amount of hours can actually play and not be completely dominated by a clan that is full of complete try-hards. This will help new players learn the game and build some confidence in the game rather than quitting before really getting into the game. The servers should also monitor chats more as they are super toxic and childish. I suppose that is part of the community, but why? This game has mature content, why not keep the chat's standards somewhat mature, too? Finally, the game crashes waaaay too much. If there is a well-known cause for this, there should be an easy to go to troubleshoot page to help users figure out what the cause is so they can do something to help remedy this if it is a user issue, like a lack of power or something with the equipment they use. Other than those few things, I find it a fun and addicting game. I play it with my two teens all the time, though they do most of the pvp since I'm more of a chill roleplayer.

Where could I even start? Rust is made by the same company as Garry's Mod, which if you know anything about what hot garbage that game is you can already expect Rust. It's unresponsive, dated, the anticheat doesn't do anything. Ignoring all those fatal flaws, the core gameplay centers on building a base and stockpile of gear in order to even play. How this works is unless you play the hour a server resets (wipes) it is just you with middling melee vs dozens of guys with guns who will hunt you to the end of the earth even if you have nothing, because they enjoy the kill. It's a great game for unemployed sociopaths and streamers (same thing).

I often praised the developers, not many push monthly updates and content at the rate Facepunch do but since the "OTV" surge in players they have really feel out of touch with the veteran players and failed to listen to most feedback then June 2nd they butchered their game. Read into the history of H1Z1 and Daybreak games, I might be wrong but it I believe Facepunch have just done the same to their game.

The game has transitioned from a game with a high skill ceiling and a steep learning curve to a game with a very low skill ceiling with very little to learn other than the controls and basic map knowledge.

I'm not gatekeeping and was never against making the game more accessible. This update was rushed, testing lasted 1 Week , keep in mind this is the biggest update that has been released since Legacy Rust transitioned into the Rust we know today.

Recoil - The pattern could've been changed to lower the amount of time investment needed, could have stayed the same but reduced, certain attachments could have been buffed but the changes that have been made remove any type of skilful gun play make every gun trivial to use. The game has now turned into who sees who first, you will die in less than 1 second to everyone regardless of game knowledge. There is no time to react, wall, or attempt to get into any type of cover when somebody shoots at you, if they see you first you are dead.

CSGO is a perfect example of a good recoil system, there is patterns but the game is still very accessible however if you take the time to learn the recoil system you will take your game to another level, I think this would have been a better direction to go in.
Sounds - On the testing branch there was "placeholder" sounds, a little into the testing they added the new sounds, keep in mind testing lasted 1 week so they probably had 3-4 days at most to gather feedback on them. If you are sitting in your base and somebody shoots 4 grids away it will sound like they are in your compound, the directional sound is also very bad and sometimes you can not tell at all where shots are coming from.

Optimisation - It is great that the content flow is so high and new things are being added to the game however, since the HDRP graphics overhaul the game has simply looked worse and performed worse declining with each update, it is nice to see new monuments added, small touches like the ziplines and graffiti but when performance is so bad surely it should be improved before more assets are added to the game.

Game Filters - Whether it is reshade, nvidia game filter or some other method that you can use to change the game appearance is irrelevant. The game without sharpen, vibrance and other colour modifications is very grey dull and quite hard to see certain things especially since the HDRP update. On top of the aforementioned the developers force a PITCH BLACK night time in this game and there was a game filter that allowed you to see a lot greater than any other player leading to some people being disadvantaged.

Disallowing these programs and not addressing the reason they are being used in the first place is the problem not the filters themselves. Another huge issue is they still work for some people making the game even more unfair as now they only work for a very few and are not available for everyone.

The best way to explain my feelings on this game is through a story. So this monster cockroach had taken up residence in my bathroom for like the last year but whenever I tried to catch him he would always slip my grasp. About a week ago I finally corner the bastard in a cartoon box. I find a way to maneuver the roach into the toilet without wasting any time, and a sense of victory washes over me. But is this enough? Oh hell no I want this fucker to suffer. I decide I'm going to drop a load on him before I flush him, a dishonorable sendoff. So I get on the toilet and start going to work. It starts coming out and this is one solid log I had been holding on to for about half an hour I aim by looking through my legs, all is going well, the log is right on coarse. Eventually it makes contact, and this is when all hell breaks lose. The roach goes full rambo and climbs UP MY SHIT towards my butthole! I panic and start jumping around like a 50's housewife who just spotted a rat. Mind you my log hadn't been broken yet so I'm spreading that shit all over the bathroom in the process. Best part? The little bastard got away. Now I'm sitting on my computer procrastinating cleaning my bathroom covered in fecal matter.
 takes away the pain of a cockroach crawling up my ass

The game is extremely buggy and more knowledgeable players WILL exploit these bugs to destroy everything you've built in the hopes of getting a rise out of you. Power scaling is weird and makes little sense when a rocket doesn't destroy a wooden wall but spears can be used to destroy stone walls. The community is as toxic as they come and has unfortunately become a home for some awful people including racists, neo nazis, and homophobes (as well as those who pretend to be in order to get a rise out of you).

All that said the building mechanics are some of the best in the survival crafting genre and crafting/researching new items is quite enjoyable. Also nothing beats the satisfaction of raiding the guy who door-camped you for four hours or off-lining the clan with swastikas on their walls.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

An open-world multiplayer game with one catch... complete and total anarchy.

In my opinion, this is Rust's greatest strength and it's greatest weakness. You start with nothing and progress by gathering resources, building a base, crafting weapons/armors, etc. However, your interaction with the other players is what makes Rust special, as it can keep the experience from getting boring and provides incentive to improve at the game.

Because players can do what they want, anything can happen and THIS is what the game is all about. The game is centered around player conflict, but alliances can be indirectly formed with other players.

Rust can be the most brutal, but also the most rewarding game if you invest the time into it. That being said, I do recommended the game to others, ***so long as you know what to expect going into it.***

What to expect:
- You will die A LOT. Because of the nature of the game, everyone assumes you are a threat before anything else and will kill on sight most of the time. Other players are just toxic... get used to it. This makes it tough to get started but it gets better with experience.
- Your default should be: DO NOT trust anyone. There are some genuinely kind players out there, but weeding out scumbags is a skill itself that can be developed.
- Your base can be destroyed by other players. You'll learn to recover quickly and get back up and running when this happens. With time and practice, you can be the one dishing out the carnage.

Though I find Rust to be a fun game, there are certain qualities and prerequisites I cannot meet.

For one, I only have a couple friends on Steam and neither of them own rust and are very unlikely to play it anyway... of course, the biggest issue because having friends to play this with is better than playing alone.

Secondly, dedication. This game demands at least a bit for you to: Maintain your base, defend your base, fight off competition, etc.. If you don't have that time, the patience, or the desire to do any of that, then all the work you put into it is basically gone.

Thirdly, and finally, hardware. I have decent hardware, and yet my PC struggles to boot up Rust in less than 30 minutes. It takes the same amount of time to log into a server even if there's low ping, further adding to my frustration. And if that weren't enough, it's borderline impossible to see other players from a great distance despite my above-average monitor... and yet, they can see me and it always gets me killed.

A complete survival game, with all features that can be expected from such a game. 

[i]This is a first impression review. I let a friend and my son play this, because I can't myself due to a handicap. [/i] 

[h2]Stranded naked[/h2]
You start the game waking up on a beach with nothing but a crude stone. You can smash the stone into trees or rocks to instantly receive the appropriate resources. With those you can craft tools, weapons and a base in order to survive. There are primary needs, such as hunger and thirst to overcome, but also other players and wild animals that have a grudge against you. Survival game 101, they pretty much all function this way. 

Whether or not this game is in particular the survival game to play, comes down to a few factors. 
- Friends. If played with friends, any game is infinitely more fun! 
- personal preference. 
- the game population. At moment of writing there are 88000 players playing. In Rust you need other players. 

My views of this game are very limited, as I haven't spent hundreds of hours in it. It looks good, but it seems a very basic survival game. The one remarkable thing I noticed was the unearthly long loading times! I haven't seen loading times of several minutes in well over a decade ago, and I think it's a huge problem of this game. 

70/100

First of all. This review is based on my low playtime.
The idea of what rust can and could have been is good.
It's the current playerbase who turned this review the way it did.

--{Gameplay}---
Like I said. The game mechanics, idea and execution actually is super cool. However as a new player you don't get a good first impression. Let me explain:
So I loaded up the game with a friend of mine. I spawn on a beach and start running clueless around smashing trees and rocks. After a couple minutes I figured out how to build a tiny shit.. I mean shed. 
I go back outside to try to find my friend. At this point another player runs up to me. I say "Hey I'm friendly, I'm new to the game" he then replies "Fuck you (Insert 3x racist words here)" and proceeds to scream and play racist songs through his mic as he kills me. 
First I think that I was just unlucky to have met one bad person. I soon found out that ~80% of the players are like that.

Generally super toxic and unfriendly community. I left the game feeling annoyed more that happy(Which is what I'd like to feel after playing a game). Which resulted in me uninstalling the game and I've not touched it since. 
Now some people may reply to this saying that this is just how this type of game genre is.
But I can say it's not. I've played SCUM, Unturned, DayZ ETC. And yes they had toxic people as well. But it was a much nicer experience as a new player to play those games over Rust.

I recommend this game with caveats. At its core Rust is a very fun game. Base building, crafting, farming, the aesthetics, all of it make for a great game. The problem comes with the fact that it's nearly a full-time job in its vanilla state. Rust greatly rewards players who can sink many thousands of hours into the game because of the meta (raiding, spray patterns, PVP, etc). If you're someone who can play it like a full-time job, great! If not, I recommend looking in to modded servers that reduce base upkeep, increase resource yields, or even non-PVP servers.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

One of my favourite games of the past, the scene greatly improved over the years, there isn't much toxicity anymore but the game got incrisingly flustrating and not fun as a solo. Massive clan bases dominating the beaches of freshspawns and raiding every offline base in the area on a wipe day, roofcampers who never get off their roofs, massive zergs, Chinese man with 3 hours on record who beams you from across the map. However this game is special, it's being improved with active ever growing community, if you like survival games that put a little more on a PvP/raiding aspect it's a game for you. Oh yeah there's also really advanced electrics and farming so if you're interested in that you'll be in haven, also there is drawing, had some fun on that on :3

Gameplay is fine, slow, but fine. the main issue with this game is the extreme level of toxicity, racism, and aggression of most players you will interact with on ANY server, official, modded, or otherwise. 
Even PvE servers, which is not very common, have toxic people in chat. I'd say if you play league of legends and are as toxic or can handle a worse experience than the community of league this game is for you. then otherwise don't spend you money on this game.

Rust isn't about building a pretty fort with your friends, logging out and then coming back tomorrow to pick up where you left. No, Rust is about psychology. I have watched a bunch of naked men with rocks rove the hillside in search of the "clothed" and kill mercilessly. I have watched people come together over d*ck paintings they created together. Sometimes you will join a server and there is a small group that take everything and leave nothing. You might even be taken prisoner or trapped and then taunted until eventually it is too much and you give up on life. Much like real life there are good people and bad people. If you take games too seriously, you won't enjoy this. This is survival of the numbers and occasionally survival of the most clever. Never give up, never give in, it all starts with a rock.

So far, I can say that this game is very immersive and gets you feeling like you are in it.

With this said, a lot of players take your actions personally and lots of toxicity floats around.

However, I found that like in real life, these players are mostly trying to just have fun. Some of them only have fun killing or being toxic towards you. So every players experience varies. With that, the actual Review.

The visuals are great if your computer can handle them.
Game design is simple and brilliant, the more complex you wish it to be, the more complex it can be.

Base building is fun.
Raiding other players is fun.
Counter Raiding successfully is hella fun.
Gathering Materials is relaxing with sudden spikes of terror provided by sudden auditory ques. Sometimes it's the music. Sometime it's the sound of nearby gunfire. Sometimes its a bear, wolf, boar or naked.

Highly recommended. You will find yourself spending thousands of hours in this game.

I haven't played this game in years so understand, the PVP was soul crushingly hard as a noobie solo, then they added PVE and it was even more soul crushingly hard. Lets be clear, no matter what they did or can ever do is make this a game you can ONLY play PVP w/ homies. Sure, I could do purely run a passworded server myself and do pure pve, but that as they say is neither here nor there. So. in final sumation, take my word as somebody who learned the hard-way playing solo for over 1000 hours, understand this is a game that at it's core gives every advantage to an aggressor and not a co-operative solo player. Its just human nature. You know it, I know it, and the developers know this, and so you can bet me a taco twelve pack if it aint true that this is a game that incentivises such.

This is the hardest and stressful survival game I’ve ever played. No matter how good you're doing, no matter what you have. This game will take away and push you back down to square one. Now despite that sounding awful it does have a lot of pros. Firstly the look is just jaw dropping, I know a lot of survival games go off that realistic look but I think Rust does it the best. Secondly the combat, if you’ve played games like Dayz it’ll go off that feel. Hectic fire fights between party’s over anything, even a can of beans. And lastly the music holy shit is the music good, I even got some of it on my phone like the main menu and warlord. Now even with this review being a positive I will say that Rust is not for the faint of heart. Despite losing all your stuff in a blink of an eye the community is very toxic. Plenty of racists, swastikas, and homophobes. I remember one time I was walking around a fresh spawn, and a guy shot me and said “sorry pal but you're black”. So if you're not strong willed or just don’t prefer that then don’t buy this game.

Bare-bones AI - Every bear, every scientist, every chicken have eyes covering every square inch of their heads. And those eyes have 100/100 vision, able to seeing through walls, in pitch black, through your base. Just play around with a scientist by peaking in and out of their LOS, then you'll see just how miserable PVE is in this game.

Toxic community - Bustling servers entail the loud and obnoxious, uncontrollable racism, full-time griefers, clans seeking record time in making new players leave, uninstall, and demand a refund. Sparse servers entail unfettered door campers, stalkers, ESP trolls and stash swipers/breakers.

Hackers - Hackers are EVERYWHERE. Some smart about not getting caught, some not so much. But they are EVERYWHERE, because Rust is apparently not as complicated of a game and crucial coding not so ssafeguarded. Who would've thought!

Strict but barbaric Anti-cheat system - How many fluke flyhack violations will it take to get to the tootsieroll center of a tootsie pop?

This game is nearing its 10 year anniversary and the amount of bugs and game flaws/exploits I come across is unprecedented. Mini helicopter suddenly go boom mid-flight. I'm standing on top of a tipped boat, then somehow mount it, sitting upside-down, underwater. 5 bears clipped inside a marsh shack, I get up close for a screenshot, then they all noclip out like a scene straight from the grudge. A stranded floatation despawning from right under my feet, literally LAUNCHING me 15ft deep in water because that obviously wasn't intended to happen. Safe Zones hurt you more than help you.

Just Play DayZ (1000 times better)

Easy Anti Cheat is a joke, so i recently got hacked, i had my phone number and email associated with my steam account. I received no email or sms message and after receiving my account back roughly 7 hours later, i see i have an alert that i have been permanently banned from rust. So i load in, and i see whoever hacked me went onto an official server and hacked, so i go to appeal for an unban request through easy anti cheat and maybe 4 hours later i get a response saying that i need to protect my account better and they cant unban me regradless of who was on the account at the time. Please tell me what the point of having an unban appeal if its not possible to become unbanned i'm debating on buying another copy or not. I only have 82 hours on the game and i already cannot play agin i like rust so i think im going to buy another copy but im very dissapointed with Easy Anti Cheat and Steam.

If you're a filthy casual such as myself. Pick another game.

Server lag is ridiculous in the game. And it's all servers. My computer can handle the game better than the servers can. PVP is stale and the PVP servers are dominated by people who play incessantly. Casual players are relegated toPVE. There's a marked failure to provide any safe haven for new or casual players. The game has great potential and could be very engaging but it would require some thoughtful development. Like most games these days this one seems to be headed in the direction of appealing to addiction rather than strategy.

[h1] Countless hours of entertainment [/h1]

[b] I could spend days working on this review but I will keep it simple for everyone.
The competition makes most of rust up, you cant go one day without a challenge and not being able to advance is a challenge. Everything from raiding to shooting has been thought about, are you going to be
countered when raiding? You don't know... Is there anything decent inside the base? You don't know...
Its this lack of info that makes Rust unique and there are no other games like it.  [/b]

[h1] The stories [/h1]

[b] Ah so you read this far to go here? Well, Rust has many stories that you can always remember... I know this part is short, however I will upload many of my stories on Rust on a variety of servers, check it out at youtube (via my profile) [/b]

[h1] The End [/h1]

> wake up on beach
> wander
> meet some guys dressed up in trash holding AK-47s
> "HEY YOU, NAKED"
> I come
> "Follow us, you're our prisoner now"
> They bring me to a base with a crudely drawn ISIS flag on it
> They bring me into their base
> "SING FOR US"
> I don't say anything
> "well you're ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ useless aren't you"
> "bring him in the thunderdome"
> waitwhat
> they bring me into a prison with another naked
> "NOW FIGHT!"
> me and the naked fight intensely with rocks
> I kill him, everyone is screaming "ALLAHU AKBAR" in bad middle-eastern accents
> they bring me outside for a break
> one ISIS member leaves the base, and I run outside while the door is open
> being shot at by AK-47's while zigzagging
> I escape into the desert

Ok, i think the game is one of the best survival games, so many good mechanics and content and you can't take that away from the game. OMG, the GUNPLAY and PVP it's ONE OF THE WORST I have ever seen in an FPS GAME!!!!!.
I don't know where to start, movement is super clunky feels like a robot, full INPUT LAG, DELAY, and animation takes ages!!.
Can't ADS while jumping, can't SHOOT while jumping if you try to swap weapon or item while the animation is playing "EVEN IF IS THE LAST FRAME" if you take the weapon back you need to do the ENTIRE ANIMATION AGAIN!!!!! even if you already put the new magazine in and load the chamber!.
And finally, after ages try to go in ADS, as soon you press the left mouse to shoot you gotta be ready for one of the worst gun recoil i have ever experienced in my 15 years of FPS games.
It's totally unplayable the gun swing left and right like it's shooting .50 cal, i don't want to spend 2000hours trying to learn a gun pattern this is not what an fps game is and the worst part is not this.
If i am controlling the recoil how i am supposed to be at 100% of my aim? i can't control recoil like this and pretend to have the same tracking flicking and mouse control i have on a normal game.
Anyway, i am uninstalling this game, and i will come back ONLY if the gunplay gets updated because atm feels like a game from 2005.

Awesome and very interesting game. It requires a lot of your time. Graphics are fine and gameplay is fairly okay. This game could be harsh on new comers as it requires a fair amount of knowledge of survival games. The learning curve is pretty straight forward. One down side to this is it needs a lot of processing power along with graphics processing and a fast internet connection. Medium to slow internet connect would be a disaster. Bottom line, make sure you have atleast 16 GB of RAM, any Intel 6th gen processor/or equivalent  and a fast internet connection before buying this.

I like when big black people punching with a rock and shooting me with a AK-47(popularnija varijanta "AKM" ili "Avtomat Kalašnjikova, modernizirani" automatsko je jurišno oružje korišteno u većini država Istočnoga bloka tijekom hladnoga rata. Standardiziran 1947. godine, dizajnirao ga je Mihajl Kalašnjikov, a prvotni proizvođač bio je ruski IZH.[1] U usporedbi s većinom automatskih pušaka u II. svjetskom ratu, AK je kompaktan, gađa na pristojnu udaljenost, snažan je i sposoban za mijenjanje načina pucanja (automatski, poluautomatski, a postoji i opcija namještanja na način da je potrebno repetirati nakon svakoga metka). Jedan je od prvih pravih jurišnih pušaka, a u širokoj upotrebi je i danas, najpopularnija jurišna puška ikada. Proizvedeno je više modela AK-a od ijednog drugog borbenog oružja.[1] Brojne derivacije i obrasci pušaka u drugim zemljama se osnove na njoj, pogotovo popularno u siromašnijim zemljama gerilskih vojnika i gerilama Arapskih zemlja, bivšeg Sovjetskog bloka itd.)
